loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque sus padres eran pobre y el decidió apoyar a su padre para recompensar el sacrificio que ellos con mucho esfuerzo le han dado a él y a su hermana.

Juan, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, él junto a su hermana procesan la leche y elaboran productos lácteos para comercializar para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, pero también la utilizan para consumo; los terrenos en donde cultiva y pasta su ganado está en mismo terreno de la casa.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para incrementar la producción de productos lácteos y para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

Juan, sueña con poder continuar estudiando porque es un medio de superación, para poder aplicar a un mejor empleo.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old. He studied through ninth grade but could not continue his studies because is parents were poor. He decided to support his father to repay the sacrifice his parents have given him and his sister through much effort.

Juan works in agriculture and the cattle industry. Juan and his sister process milk and make dairy products to sell in order to meet the needs of his family. However, they also use the milk for consumption. His house is on the same land where he farms and his livestock graze.

Juan needs this loan to buy a cow in order to increase the production of dairy products and to meet the needs of his family.

Juan hopes to be able to continue studying, as it is a means of self-improvement, and he wants to be able to apply to a better job.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito never gets tired in attending his business. His sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, for he owns the only store in their place. He's making good sales on his business that sufficiently support the needs of his family.

In need of additional capital to restock his sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others, he asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where Juanito is an active member.

loans.use: to restock his sari-sari (convenience) store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he keeps livestock. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a productive area, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more livestock. His business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. He also owns rental houses.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 42 years old and married with four children; two of whom are in school. she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Thelma has a general store business in the Philippines. Thelma requested 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items such as school supplies, snack food and other groceries.

Thelma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as school supplies, snack food and other groceries.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married with three children. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, bread and other snack foods.

Violeta has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Alysson Gabriela

texts.es:
Alysson es una joven emprendedora de 21 años, quien vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo en casa de sus abuelos. 
Ella desde que salió del colegio le ha gustado trabajar para ayudar a su familia y apoyarlos, hace cuatro años comenzó  en un almacén vendiendo ropa, aunque no era muy bien remunerada pero ella estaba feliz por ser su primer trabajo, actualmente trabaja en una panadería en la sección de administración llevando la contabilidad de la empresa, ya los fines de semana pasa en familia y ayudando en lo que más pueda. Comenta que siempre ha tenido un sueño el de tener su propio negocio, para q algún día no muy lejano pueda dedicarse netamente a él. Por ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa, la única institución en la ciudad que apoya a que personas con sueños de salir adelante puedan hacerlo realidad, por ello con este crédito y con el apoyo de su madre podrá iniciar su negocio, vender ropa, aunque al principio es difícil ganar clientela pero está segura que con su carisma se le hará más fácil, ya tiene planificado a los sectores donde recorre a vender su mercadería.
Agradece a la institución y al proyecto KIVA por apoyar a que las personas puedan montarse su propio negocio y poder fortalecerlo más.
texts.en:
Alysson is a 21-year-old entrepreneur, who lives in the city of Santo Domingo with her grandparents.

Since she left school she has enjoyed working to help her family and support them. Four years ago she started in a warehouse selling clothing, even though she wasn't very well paid but she was happy for it to be her first job. Now she works in a bakery in the accounting department of the company, now she spends weekends with family and helping as much as she can.

She says that she has always had a dream of having her own business, so that one day not too far away she could dedicate herself only to that. For that reason she came to Fundación Alternativa (Alternative Foundation), the only institution in the city that helps people with dreams of getting ahead to make their dreams reality.

So with this loan and with the support of her mother she will start her business, sell clothing, even though at the beginning it is difficult to gain clientele but she is sure that with her charisma she will make it easier, she already has a plan for the areas she will go through to sell her merchandise.

She appreciates the institution and the KIVA project for helping people to be able to start their own business and being able to strengthen it more.

loans.use: to launch her business selling clothes, in this way she will be able to support her grandparents and become a micro entrepreneur.

loans.name: Aldren

texts.en:
Aldren is 36 years old and married with five children. He resides at Kinuman Sur in Ozamiz City. His primary income is to make charcoal. He purchases coco shells and makes them into charcoal for sale. He has been in this business for many years to earn a living and meet his children's education needs.

He requested a loan from GDMPC to buy more coconut shells for charcoal-making to sell in volume in the city. He wants to expand his business and use his returns to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 61 years old and a widow from Pagadian city. She is a business woman engaged in retailing business. She's been doing this type of business since she retired from the government service. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, where she is a regular depositor and an active member.

She had availed various programs and services including insurance products also. Recently, she asked for a loan to pay for hospital bills and purchase maintenance medicines.

She has high hopes that she can maintain her membership status with the cooperative, and wishes that the cooperative can expand it's area of operations.

loans.use: to pay for hospital bills and purchase medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shiela is 26 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Shiela has a selling of oysters business in the Philippines. Shiela requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of oysters to sell to her customers.

Shiela has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of oysters to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lucena works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Lucena is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as, sugar, flour, oil, vegetable, etc.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, oil, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Savoeur

texts.en:
Savoeur is a 44-year-old married woman with two children.  They live in a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Steong Sen district, in Cambodia.  One of her children still attends school.  To make a living, Savoeur has worked as a teacher in the village for twenty years. 

Savoeur has never worked with VisionFund before, and is now asking for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.  She hopes that this loan will keep her daughter in school until graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Marileth

texts.es: Marileth es una mujer laboriosa, con muchas aspiraciones de crecer y prosperar su negocio, tiene la edad de 32 años, es acompañada y madre de tres hijos de 12,6 y 3 años, su negocio es la venta de tortilla y frijoles cocidos desde hace dos años, solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para invertir en la compra de maíz, leña, frijoles y el pago del molino.
texts.en:
Marileth is an industrious woman, with aspirations for her business to grow and prosper. She is 32 year old, in a relationship, and a mother to three children, aged 12, 6 and 3. Her business is selling tortillas and cooked beans, which she has been doing for two years. 

She is requesting, for her first cycle, the institution's financing to invest in the purchase of corn, firewood, beans, and to pay for grinding.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and beans

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Roberto has always had the enthusiasm for farming. He has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Roberto knows that he has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Roberto hopes to buy a tractor to lessen the cost of land preparations.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Gladis Yrlanda

texts.es: Gladis es una señora de 50 años vive junto a su hijo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, es madre soltera, por ello le ha tocado trabajar duro para sacar a su hijo adelante, desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de empanadas, antes recorría las calles vendiendo, ahora ya arrienda un local donde atiende todos los días por las tardes, le va muy bien ya que es el único negocio en la zona. Gladys es clienta fiel de la Fundación, con el primer crédito pudo comprarse una nevera muy necesaria para su negocio, ahora incluso ya vende helados y bolos por lo que han incrementado sus ingresos. Ella siempre está agradecida con KIVA por haberle dado la oportunidad de conocerla como clienta. Ahora con este nuevo crédito podrá comprar un horno para preparar panes y así ir fortaleciendo poco a poco su negocio para seguir apoyando a su pequeño en lo elemental de la vida, la educación.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 50 year old woman who lives along with her son in the city of Santo Domingo. She is a single mother, so she has had to work hard to help her son succeed. For several years, she has prepared and sold empanadas (hand pies). Before, she sold them on the street, but now she rents a spot that is open every afternoon. This is going very well for her, since hers is the only business in the area.

Gladis is a faithful client of the Foundation (Kiva field partner). With her first loan, she bought a much-needed refrigerator for her business. Now, she also sells ice cream and other frozen treats, which has grown her income. She is always grateful to Kiva for having given her the opportunity to be a client.

Now, with this new loan she can buy an oven to prepare bread, and therefore slowly strengthen her business to continue helping her little one with a fundamental part of life: his education.

loans.use: with the purchase of an oven to prepare bread and increase her products and clientele. With these earnings, she will be able to focus on her son's education.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. She runs a retail shop and farms, and has been in business for four years.

Sarah earns a monthly income of 80,000 Kenyan shillings. This is her 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock like sugar, rice, maize flour, detergents; cooking oil, etc. for selling in her shop.

Sarah will use the profits from her expanded business to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer as well as clothing and other goods for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to make the lives of her children happy.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, detergents, cooking oil, etc. for selling in her shop.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is a 48-year-old married man with two children.  He lives in a rural village of Kampong Thom province’s Stoeng Sen district, in Cambodia.  He and his wife have earned a living planting rice for 20 years.  Sometimes they work for others for a fee to earn additional income.  The main challenge for his business has been low crop yield as a result of a flood.

This is the first loan for Heang with VisionFund.  He is now asking for a loan to pay for his daughter’s school fee to study marketing.  He hopes this loan will enable his daughter to stay in school so she can find a good job after her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter’s school fee to study marketing.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, who is in his mid 30s, is married with four children; two of them are in school, and the other two are still small. He has been running a salon business for one and a half years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small profit per month.

This will be Bahati's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the salon products and has paid back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees for the two children, to repay the loan and cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment to meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of owning a food shop.

Bahati will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment to meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda is 67 years old, and a widow with two adult aged children. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for five years. She asks for a loan from the cooperative to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase her medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is a married woman with five children. She is 39 years old and four of her children are in school.

Ma. Ana is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as coconut oil, sugar, rice, and other spices.

Ma. Ana has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as coconut oil, sugar, rice, and other spices.

loans.name: Martha Eva

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijas, de trece y diez años, quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Tiene 37 años y vive actualmente en la Ciudad de México, en donde tiene su negocio.
Hace trece años, después de conocer un promotor de venta por catálogo, Martha aprovechó la oportunidad y se inició en la venta de ropa, zapatos y artículos para el hogar por catálogo, con el fin de tener una mejor calidad de vida y más oportunidad de trabajo.
Martha dedica gran parte de su tiempo a este negocio y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y crear una cartera de clientes más amplia, para poder establecer una boutique fija. Para esto, Martha solicitó un crédito que le ha permitido comprar más mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, cosa que ha resultado muy favorablemente.
Orgullosa de su lucha y ganas de salir adelante, Martha tiene la motivación de continuar en la venta por catálogo y seguir brindando confianza y excelencia a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is a hard-working woman and mother of two girls, aged thirteen and ten, who depend on her economically. She is 37 years old and currently lives in Mexico City, where she has her business.

Thirteen years ago, after meeting a catalog sales promoter, Martha seized the opportunity and started selling clothing, shoes, and household items by catalog, in order to have a better quality of life and more work opportunities. Martha dedicates a large part of her time to the business, and her dream is to grow her business and create a broader customer base, in order to establish a fixed boutique.

For this, Martha requested a loan which has allowed her to buy more merchandise to increase her sales, which has resulted very favorably. Proud of her struggle and desire to succeed, Martha is motivated to continue in her catalog sales and continue offering confidence and excellence to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to grow her sales.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum MPC.  She decided to give it a try after she learned she can obtain financial assistance for her chosen business.  

To this day, Carmelita has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default.  She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.  Recently, she obtained a loan to pay for land and seed bed preparation for her chosen business.  Carmelita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 56 years old. She is married and blessed with three children.

Agnes has a farming business, which she has been in for six years. She earns a monthly income of 8,500 Kenyan shillings.

This is Agnes' second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds to boost production. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her grandchildren.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her grandchildren and improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds to boost production.

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en:
Julieto landed at a right place for his needed capital when he joined PMPC. He knew this would be his last chance to get back on his feet when went broke after his first business went bad. PMPC to Julieto came to the rescue for lending him money when he needed it the most.

Now, he has taken another loan for the next cropping season. He borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.

Julieto perseveres and always believes in reaching his goal to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 34 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Liezel works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of goods to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Betty

texts.en:
Ma. Betty is 56 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school, and she works very hard to provide for all of them.

Ma. Betty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ma. Betty would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Pina

texts.en:
Ma. Pina is 36 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Ma. Pina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Pina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, biscuits, snack foods, and other groceries.

Ma. Pina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ma. Pina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, biscuits, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a married woman who is 28 years old now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies such as monitors, mouses, keyboards, etc. for her business.

Mabel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as monitors, mouses, keyboards, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Lelimy

texts.en:
Maria Lelimy is 37 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maria Lelimy has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lower Eastern Development Organization Group

texts.en:
Lower Eastern Development Organization Group was in taken in the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa program in 2014 with an aim of learning more on group dynamics, also on savings mobilization and on enterprise.

The person in the photograph is Kameme, who is 58 years old, married and has four children. She joined HiH-EA with an aim of learning more on savings and enterprise development.

She operates a kiosk selling foodstuffs to earn a living. She is borrowing her first loan to boost her business by buying stock of sugar, flour and cooking oil. This will increase her income that she plans to use in educating her children.

She appreciates Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay well.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour and cooking oil. This will increase the income that she plans to use in educating her children.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Elpedia tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Elpedia borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Elpedia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 44 years old, married with three children of adult age and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Her wish is to send her children to school until they finish college and land a good job. She doesn't want to see her children doing back breaking work in tilling and cultivating land like what she's doing to provide for their needs.

Merlyn is a hardworking farmer and a loving mother to her children. To get a head start for the next cropping season, she seeks a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing, and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing, and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Marivic has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Khursandmurod

texts.ru: Хурсандмурод очень хороший и целеустремленный человек. Ему 37 лет. Он из района Хуросон. Хурсандмурод женат и отец троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка, она не имеет работу. Хурсандмурод 7 лет занимается куплей и продажей одежды. Это дело ему передал его брат. Работа идет хорошо. Хурсандмурод хорошо общается с клиентами и помогает им выборам одежды. Есть хороший доход, но у него имеется мало одежды на продажи. Для увеличения товаров ему необходима большая сумма. Поэтому за помощью Хурсандмурод обращается к Вам. В надежде на Вашу поддержку. Хурсандмурод благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Khursandmurod is a very nice and ambitious man. He's 37 years old. He comes from the district of Khuroson. Khursandmurod is  married, the father of three. He's wife is a housewife, she is unemployed. Khursandmurod has been involved in buying and selling clothes for seven years. This  Business has been busting to hear from his brother. His work is going well. Khursandmurod treats his customers very well and helps them choose the clothes.  He earns a decent income, but he doesn't have a wide range of clothes for sale. To increase the range of products, he needs a big sum of money, which is why she turned to you for help. He is  hoping for your support. Khursandmurod is grateful for your help!

loans.use: to transport clothes

loans.name: Shaiyr

texts.ru: Шайыр успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и тем кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. Шайыр по-прежнему в сезон сдает коттеджи туристам и занимается заготовкой и перепродажей фруктов. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 23,000 сом (KGS). Шайыр вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку яблок и груш для дальнейшей их перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Shaiyr has  successfully repaid her previous loan having used it for the designated purpose. She's thankful to Kiva nd all those who responded and helped her to raise funds. Shaiyr is  still involved in renting out cottages to tourists during the season, and she also sells fruit. Her monthly income is about 23,000 som (KGS). Shaiyr turned to Bai Tushum Bank again  for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy apples and pears  for resale. The borrowed money will be invested in the further development of the business.

loans.use: to purchase apples and pears for resale

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина 29 летняя молодая женщина. Преуспевающая во всех своих делах. У нее 3 детей, которых она воспитывает сама. Парвина занимается скотоводством. Этому она научилась у мамы. Благодаря этой работе ее жизнь будет идти вперед. Это очень трудная работа, но Парвина уверенна в своих силах. Для улучшения  и увеличения скота ей необходима большая сумма. За помощью она обращается к Вам. Парвина заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Parvina is a 29-year-old young woman who is very successful in everything she does. She has three kids and is a single mother. She is involved in  breeding livestock what she has learned from her mother. Thanks to her work, her life is moving forward. Her work is very hard but Parvina is confident in her efforts.  To improve and increase her livestock, she needs a big sum of money. She is turning to you for help. Parvina is grateful in advance for your help!

loans.use: to purchase livestock and increase the headcount

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун целеустремленный молодой человек из Курган-Тюбе. Ему 20 лет но, не смотря на свой юный возраст, Фаридун работает в местной школе преподавателем.  Он пока что не женат, но в семье их 5 человек. Фаридун как может, вносит свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Кроме преподавания Фаридун увлекается фотографированием.  Его мечта основать фото-студию в городе.  Однако для осуществления этой мечты Фаридун хочет первым делом купить профессиональную фотокамеру. Для этого он обратился к вам за помощью и верит, что Вы сможете воплотить его мечту в реальность.
texts.en: Faridun is a young and ambitious man from Kurgan-Tyube. He is 20 years old, but despite his young age, Faridun is working as a teacher in the local school. He is not married yet, but he's family includes five people. Faridun is trying to contribute to the family's budget as much as he can. Besides teaching, he is keen on photography. His dream is to set up a photo studio in the city. However, to realize this dream Faridun first needs to buy a professional photo camera. This is the reason he requested your help, and he believes that you can help make his dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy a professional photo camera

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жительница района Хуросон Чамила. Она 41 летняя жена и мать. Чамила занимается скотоводством у себя во дворе. Этому делу она научилась у мамы. Чамила очень опытная дехканка в этом деле. В этой сфере она занимается уже 9 лет. Чамила знает свое дело. У Чамили 5 детей. Она хорошая мама и замечательный работник. Чамила хочет приобрести скота и расширить деятельность. Для завершения данной операции у Чамилы нет денег. С такими надеждами она обратилась за кредитом.  Ей просто необходима Ваша поддержка. С Вашей помощи Чамила может стать успешным скотоводом.
texts.en: A resident of the Khuroson district, Chamila is a 41-year-old wife and mother. She has been breeding livestock in her own back yard. She has learned this from her mother. Chamila is a very experienced dekhan farmer.  She has been doing this for nine years and has become very good at it. Chamila has five children. She isa good mother and an amazing worker. She wants to buy livestock and expand her business. To realize her plan, though, she does not have enough money. With these hopes in mind, she requested a loan. She just needs your help, and with your help, she will be able to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old. He is hard working and ambitious. He operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in a town called Kabwe, located in the central province of Zambia.

This will be Paul’s fourth loan from Kiva. He has successfully repaid all his previous loans on time. Being a Kiva beneficiary has allowed Paul to grow his business. He now has 16 outlets and employs 22 young adults across his network of mobile money outlets. His personal life has also improved greatly. He now lives in a fully furnished house and is able to help out his family members with things like food, housing, and school fees for his young niece.

He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their continued support throughout the years. Paul is applying for a new loan so that he can increase the working capital across his 16 shops. This will allow Paul to serve his customers more efficiently as he will have increased cash flow for the hundreds of customers who transact at his outlets on a daily basis.

Being able to run his own business has allowed Paul to give back to his community by creating employment opportunities and helping people have access to financial services, in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class.

At the present time, Paul does not have the necessary capital needed to execute his vision and objectives. Connecting with Kiva lenders will boost his business while simultaneously jump starting opportunities for future employees who are also looking to become entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to generate capital in order to grow his business so that mobile money can be accessible to more people.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 50 years old and is a married woman. She is a responsible mother of two children. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is doing a job in a factory. He has some cattle at home and produces milk which Rubina sells in her locality. He has been keeping his herd at home; through breeding he has been increasing his cattle for many years. Rubina wants to increase the milk production and wants to buy an additional cow so that she could grow the herd. However due to lack of capital she is unable to buy the cow.

Therefore Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy an additional cow. She hopes that now she can easily carry on her business and make progress.

Rubina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for her milk production and selling business.

loans.name: Ma. Rosalina

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalina has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years. She and her husband have been tilling their own land and carrying out farming activity that primarily provides for the needs of her family.

Ma. Rosalina found out that their income in farming is insufficient for the family needs especially at a time when their eldest child enters college. As a hardworking farmer, she also nurtures and works hard to repay her loans from the cooperative.

One time, she decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC. Ma. Rosalina is grateful for the trust the coop extended to her to allow her to be able to buy the neighboring parcel of land. She successfully repaid the loan and this cropping season, she asked for another loan to augment her production. The amount of PHP 25,000 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides.

Ma. Rosalina is hopeful that she can have good harvest this season so that she can repay ahead of schedule her loan with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides.

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.en:
Dilbaroy is a young and smart woman. She was born in the year 1992. Dilbaroy is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Dilbaroy works in a state organization. She works hard but her salay is small.

Dilbaroy needs to financial support because her children are ill. Dilbaroy is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy medicines for her children's treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her children's treatment.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a rural, smallholder crop farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. She does dairy, poultry, and crop farming besides horticulture, and she is looking to improve the efficiency of her business by replacing some equipment.

Rose is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. With the borrowed money, she plans to buy brand new tools that are modern, improved in design, durable, and comfortable to use.

The impact of this loan will be the improved welfare of tool workers, improved quality of work, and efficiency on the farm. This will contribute directly and indirectly to improved productivity of the farm.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy makes good earnings from her farming activities in Dumingag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially since she has a high cost of living now that her children entered college. Lucy approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase rice seeds That will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is preparing for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Editha hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, cereals, soap, flour and other items. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, rice and other items

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna has spent her lifetime in farming. She has mastered the craft of farming including land preparation, seed bed preparation, sowing, replanting, pre-harvest and post-harvest management and operation. She's been doing well with these activities and has generated enough income to send all her children to school until they finished college and landed good jobs. Despite the fact that she doesn't need to till her land because she receives support from her children, she is still willing to do the same routines in farming because for her, doing nothing makes her an unproductive citizen. So, just recently, she asked for a loan for farmers like her to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 31-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a very populated area.

A few days ago, he had a road accident. When he was looking for a passenger standing beside the road, a speeding car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any injury but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to replace the rickshaw body with a new one, but does not have enough cash in hand to fix it.

Therefore, Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy an auto rickshaw body and drive smoothly again.

Sidra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation service, so he can repair his rickshaw  after accidental damage.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. У Мавлуды двое детей. Она развелась с мужем 5 лет назад. После развода Мавлуда начала заниматься шитьем, чтобы кормить детей. Благодаря своей работе, которой ее научила сестра, она сама кормит свою семью. Как и все мамы Мавлуда хочет, чтоб ее дети жили в красивом и теплом доме. Она собирается сделать ремонт и создать хорошие условия. Для этого ей необходим кредит. Мавлуда надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Mavluda is a young and hard-working woman. She has two children, and divorced from her husband 5 years ago. After the divorce, Mavluda started to sew in order to feed her children. Thanks to her work, which her sister taught her, she was able to feed her family herself. Like all mothers, Mavluda wants her children to live in a beautiful and warm house. She is saving to do repairs and create good living conditions. To do this, she needs a loan. Mavluda is hoping for your help.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru:
Бобочон государственный служащий. Также он заботливый отец четверых детей. Ему 45 лет. Бобочон с семьей проживают на районе Вахш. Район не заселен большим населением. Бобочон с семьей в этом городе живут очень давно. 
   Расти 4 детей одному Бобочону тяжело. Все его дети учатся, и на их образование уходит много средств, но Бобочон не жалеет на это денег. Скоро придется оплатить обучения сына в университете и купить учебники для других детей. По этой причине Бобочон обратился за кредитом и надеется, что его дети получат достойное образование.
texts.en:
Bobojon is a civil servant, and also a caring father of four. He is 45 years old, and lives in the Vakhsh region with his family. The area is not inhabited by a large population and Bobojon and his family have lived in this town for a long time.

Raising 4 children alone is hard. All of his children are studying, and their eduction requires a lot of funds, but Bobojon does not begrudge this money. Soon he will have to pay for his son's university studies, and buy textbooks for the other children. For this reason, Bobojon applied for a loan, and hopes that his children will receive a dignified education.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his children's education.

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru: Веселый и замечательный мужчина Хайрулло. Он жизнелюбивый и заботливый отец. У него двое детей. Хайрулло родился на районе Хуросон. Он вырос в семье дехканов. Дехкани очень трудолюбивый народ. Хайрулло в детстве мечтал иметь больше скотов. 10 лет Хайрулло выращивает скота. Он продвигает деятельность отца. Хайрулло хочет, имеет больше скотов, и расширить деятельность. Путем увеличения поголовья скотов увеличиться доход. И он может хорошо обеспечить свою семью. Из-за нехватки денежных средств он просит Вас о помощи. Хайрулло очень нуждается в помощи.
texts.en: Khayrullo is a happy and remarkable man, and is a loving and thoughtful father. Khayrullo has two children, and was born in the Khuroson region. He grew up in a family of farmers, who are very hard-working people. As a child, Khayrullo dreamed of having more livestock. He has raised cattle for 10 years, and is continuing the work of his father. Khayrullo wants to have more livestock, and increase his herd. Increasing the number of livestock means an increase in income. He also wants to provide well for his family. As he has a shortage of funds, he is asking for your help. Khayrullo needs your help very much.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase his herd.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 37 лет, замужем. Образование у нее среднее. По характеру очень жизнерадостная, трудолюбивая и оптимистичная женщина. В течении 10 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 15 овец. На 0,25 Га земли выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Бактыгул составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 7 ягнят для увеличения поголовья. На прибыль от кредита она планирует и дальше развивать свое дело.
texts.en: Baktygul is 37 years old and married. She has a high school education, and is a very cheerful, hard-working and optimistic person. Over the past 10 years she has worked in animal husbandry and agriculture. She has 15 sheep on her farm, and also grows maize on 0.25 hectares of land. Baktygul's monthly income is around 6,000 som (KGS). To further expand her business, she turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS), to purchase 7 lambs to increase her total number. With profit from the loan, she plans to further expand her activities.

loans.use: to buy seven lambs in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 65 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has eight adult children.

Esterlita earns income from agri-business, particularly in coconut production. She has been engaged in this business for more than 28 years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month from this business, an amount that is so helpful to support their family needs. At present, she is also receiving monthly support from her son, a seaman.

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase four sacks of rice for retail.

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to build a bigasan outlet (a rice dealership) in her barangay.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of rice for retail.

loans.name: Jacinter

texts.en:
Jacinter is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with two children.

Her business is a retail shop and a restaurant. She has been in the business for eight years. She earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock like sugar, rice, maize flour, detergents, and cooking oil to sell in her shop.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to reinvest into the business to increase stock.

She hopes to make enough income to make her family's future bright.

loans.use: to buy stock like sugar, rice, maize flour, detergents, cooking oil to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Superlita

texts.en:
Superlita is a farmer from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 65 years old, married, and has adult children.

She is availing a loan from Paglaum MPC to prepare for the next cropping season. With the loan of PHP 25,000 she will purchase rice seeds to result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to yield healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as optimistic.

She operates a posho mill where she sells maize flour. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more maize. Her business goal is to have a well established business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more maize to mill.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчон молодой и верующий человек из не большого городка Вахдат. Ему 26 лет. Он занимается животноводством и земледелием. Он женат и ждет с нетерпением появления ребенка на свет. Толибчон живет вместе с женой, мамой и братишкой. Его братишка любит учиться, и данный момент получает образование в Университете. Из-за того что его форма обучения платное Талибчон должен оплатить обучения младшего брата. Для этого он обратился за кредитом. Толибчон надеется, что его младший брат получит образование и найдет работу по специальности.
texts.en: Tolibjon is a young man of faith, from the small town of Vahdat. He is 26 years old and works in animal husbandry and arable farming. He is married and is looking forward to his child's arrival into the world. Tolibjon lives together with his wife, mother and younger brother. His brother loves to study, and at the moment he is attending university. Because this type of study is fee-paying, Tolibjon has to pay for his brother's education. To do this, he has turned to a loan. Tolibjon hopes that his younger brother receives an education and will find work in his specialism.

loans.use: to pay for his younger brother's university education.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Его зовут Зафар. Ему 34 года. Он женат и воспитывает двоих детей. Зафар государственный служащий. Зафар не только о своих детях, но и о своем племянником заботиться. Зафар считает его своим родным ребенком. Его племянник учится в университете на платной основе. Зафар считает своим долгом ему помочь и хочет оплатить ему обучение в Университете и поэтому обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: His name is Zafar, and he is 34 years old. He is married, and has two children. Zafar is a civil servant, and not only cares for his own children, but also for his nephew. Zafar thinks of him as his own child. His nephew studies at university on a fee-paying basis. Zafar considers it his duty to help him and wants to pay for his university education, therefore he applied for a loan.

loans.use: to pay for his nephew's education.

loans.name: Preselia

texts.en:
Preselia is an enthusiastic of farmer. She cultivates rice land in Dumingag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Preselia knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Common End S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Caroline, a member of Common End S.H.G. She is 33 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa Enterprise development and financial management training. This training has enabled her to commercialize her farming and increase the profits.

She does poultry farming and she is borrowing to pay for the construction expenses of a modern poultry house. This, she believes, will greatly boost her poultry farming business by increasing income levels and consequently enabling her to pay for her children’s clothing and food.

Caroline is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To pay for construction expenses of a modern poultry house.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital.

To this day, Rachelle feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used in her business.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Rachelle wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Praxidis

texts.en:
Praxidis is juggling the management of her farming business and the supervision of the renovation of their home. Praxidis hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 4,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

Praxidis was given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she was thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is a 27-year-old retail shop proprietor at Mariakani, Kenya. He is a father of one and his wife provides additional income. For the last five years, he has been doing well in this business.

This is his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar, milk, tea leaves and washing detergents for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and expand his business. He hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar, milk, tea leaves and washing detergents for resale.

loans.name: Marie Cris

texts.en: Marie Cris is 47 years old. She is engaged in kerosene and gasoline retail at her place. She's doing this to support the needs of her family, since her husband's meager income cannot suffice to meet their needs. She signed up as a member of Paglaum MPC to access initial capitalization for her business. The amount that she asks for from the cooperative will be used to buy additional inventory of motor fuel for resale.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of motor fuel for resale.

loans.name: Jose Jr.

texts.en:
Jose is 70 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children who are now adults. Jose has been engaged in agri-business, particularly in rice production, for 20 years already. He earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from doing this type of work.

Jose has requested a loan to be used for purchasing commercial fertilizers and sprays for his rice production activity. He has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his rice production activity by acquiring more parcels of land.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en: Alita wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will enable her to continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds resulting in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as courageous.

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 65,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier of vegetables within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally has always the enthusiasm of farming. She cultivates their rice land in Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor, and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Sally knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as faithful.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, cereals, bread, soap, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap, bread and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap, bread and other items.

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.en:
Cresencio thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned that he could get financial assistance for his chosen business. Cresencio has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken out several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, Cresencio took out a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for his chosen business. He wishes to continue to manage his business effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Narda

texts.en:
Narda is 60 years old widow with five children. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Philippines.

To earn a living, Narda accepts orders and cooks rice cakes and flour cakes. She also provides general sewing services to local community members.

Narda has practiced her cooking sideline for many years, especially on important occasions. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc. used for cooking.

In 2007, Narda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients used for cooking.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she took out a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding pig heads for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con ellos y uno ya se casó.

Manuel, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, desde hace mucho tiempo aproximadamente tiene 17 años de hacerlo; su padre es agricultor y le enseño el trabajo de la siembra de los granos básicos como frijol, maíz, maicillo, entre otros; decide dedicarse a esta labor debido a que no encontró otra forma de trabajar pues no estudio y eso le dificulto encontrar un trabajo diferente.- Pero también se dedica a la pesca cuando no trabaja la agricultura y esto le genera otro ingreso adicional, la distancia de su trabajo está a pocos minutos de su casa y quien le colabora en el trabajo es su esposa y su horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.

Manuel, necesita el préstamo para comprar otra vaquilla para dedicarse a venta de leche y de queso en los tiempos de cría y producción de las vacas, con esto tendrá otra fuente de ingresos y una fuente de alimentación para la familia.

Manuel, sueña con tener otro negocio y desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que trabajen de una forma diferente.
texts.en:
Manuel, 41 years old, studied until third grade. He is partnered, his partner works as a homemaker and they have 3 children, of whom only two live with them and one got married. Manuel has been a farmer and raised cattle since a very long time ago, he's been doing it for approximately 17 years. His father is a farmer and he taught him the work of sowing the basic grains like beans, corn, sorghum, among others. He decided to dedicate himself to this work since he couldn't find another form of working, well, he didn't study and this made it difficult for him to find a different job. But also, he works fishing when he doesn't work agriculture and this generates him additional income. The distance from his home is a few minutes from his house, and he collaborates in the work with his wife; his work schedule is 6 hours a day.

Manuel needs the loan to buy another calf to dedicate it for the sale of milk and cheese in the raising time and production of the cows. With this, he will have another source of income and a source of food for the family. Manuel dreams of having another business and wishes that his children keep studying so that they can work in a different manner.

loans.use: to buy another calf to dedicate himself to selling milk and cheese.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is engaged in "pan bisaya" (native way of bread baking) production in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This business has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts bulk orders for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase bags of flour, brown sugar, leavening, yeast, margarine, butter, baking soda, and other ingredients. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open another bakery in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, brown sugar, leavening, yeast, margarine, butter, baking soda, and other baking ingredients.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yamileth es una mujer laboriosa de 41 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos de 15 y 20 años por quienes ha trabajado fuerte para que sean jóvenes de bien, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante desde hace cuatro años, con ayuda de su hermana quien vende en su domicilio, mientras ella sale a vender, solicita por primer ciclo financiamiento en la institución para invertir en la compra de camisas, faldas, chores y pantalones, de esta manera ella estaría cumpliendo una de sus metas que es aumentar la cantidad de ropa ofertada.
texts.en: Yamileth is a hardworking, 41 year old woman. She is single and the mother of two children, aged 15 and 20. She has worked very hard for them so that they will be upstanding people. She has sold used clothes as a street vendor for four years. With the help of her sister, who sells from her home, she goes out to sell. She is asking for her first loan cycle from the institution to buy shirts, skirts, shorts and pants. This way, she will be meeting one of her goals, which is to increase the amount of clothes she has to sell.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, shorts and pants.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 47 years old and married with three children. She operates her buy-and-sell clothing store to help her husband, a tailor, generate an income for her family, especially for her children's school expenses. She learnt this business from her former job as a salesperson.

Chona is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy dresses, blouses, pants, and shirts as additional items to sell in her store. She wanted to grab this opportunity to increase her income by selling more clothes for the holidays.

Chona hopes to expand her business and add more clothes to her store, as well as shoes and clothing accessories in the future.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, pants, and shirts as additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es: Blanca de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda desde hace algunos años el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar su negocio, ella está solicitando nuevamnete un crédito para la compra de de huevos, sopas, café, aceite, refrescos,  etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, 58 years old, lives in a house she owns along with her family. She has owned a small store for the last few years. It is located in her home. She has many customers, especially her neighbors. With her sales, she is able to pay some of her household's expenses.

Blanca is requesting another loan in order to buy eggs, soups, coffee, oil, soft drinks, etc. to be able to increase her profits and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, soups, coffee, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Provervio I Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario proverbio I lo conforman tres microempresarias de éxito y hombre trabajador, coordinado por Ana una mujer laboriosa de 23 años de edad, casada y madre de dos niños de 4 y 1 año, ella se dedica a la venta de celulares desde hace tres años, negocio que emprendió mediante la venta de accesorios como cargadores y auriculares con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a entregarlos, una de sus metas es incrementar el negocio y obtener buenas ganancias para comprar su casa, por lo tanto solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de celulares, tablets y accesorios. El segundo socio es Jorge de 23 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, Morelia de 18 años se dedica a la venta de fritanga y Mayra  de 46 años se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en: The Proverbio I support group is made up of three successful micro-business women  and one hardworking man. It is coordinated by Ana, a hardworking 23 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two children, aged 4 and 1. She has sold cell phones for three years. She started this business through selling accessories, such as chargers and headphones, with the support of her husband, who helps to deliver them. One of her goals is to grow her business and obtain good profits to buy her house. That is why she is asking for a loan to invest in buying cell phones, tablets and accessories. The other members are Jorge, who is 23 years old, and who sells clothes; Morelia, who is 18 and sells fritanga, and Mayra, who is 46 and sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, tablets and accessories.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, 51 years old, is married and a resident of Simacolong, Lazi, Siquijor. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold in the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Since she wants to be more productive, Pauline has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. Last May 14, 2007 both Pauline and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

Pauline has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. She hopes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday, and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 36 years old. She is married with two children.

She has had a clothes shop business for 13 years, and now she wants to diversify into dairy farming.

Everlyn has requested her 5th loan of KES 100,000 which she will be using to purchase 100 bags of cement, 40 pieces of twisted iron, and four bags of waterproof cement. She hopes this will help her to put up a dairy cattle shed in her home.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be the owner of a well-established dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase buy 100 bags of cement, 40 pieces of twisted iron, and four bags of waterproof cement to help build a dairy cattle shed in her home.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, de 42 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos que trabajan con él y estudian en la escuela de su cantón, mientras su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga de los cuidados del hogar. 

Salvador, trabaja como agricultor, principalmente siembra maíz y frijol, también tiene un pequeño huerto de tomates el cual cuida mucho, sus hijos le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa; él también tiene un molino de electricidad en su casa, para brindar servicio de molienda para sus vecinos. 

Salvador, necesita el préstamo para comprar discos nuevos, hacerle una limpieza al molino y darle mantenimiento, porque se acerca la temporada de diciembre y sus cliente llegan a moler buenas cantidades de maíz para hacer tamales.

Los planes de Salvador, son poder continuar trabajando y tener un mejor ingreso para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador is 42 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his 4 children. His children work with him and go to school in their neighborhood. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the household chores.

Salvador works in agriculture. He mainly grows corn and beans. He also has a small vegetable patch where he grows tomatoes with great care. His children help him work his parcel of land. He also has an electric mill in his house and provides this service to his neighbors.

Salvador needs the loan to buy new discs for the mill and to clean it up and perform maintenance because December is getting near and during this time his neighbors use the mill to grind great amounts of corn to make tamales.

Salvador's plans are to keep working and generate more income for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: buy new discs for his mill and clean it up and perform maintenance.

loans.name: Sayda Julia

texts.es: Laboriosa y perseverante son características que describen a Sayda, una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, quienes son su mayor motivación para trabajar día a día. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante desde hace dieciocho años, donde oferta a sus clientes variedad de estilos y colores. Ella solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de camisas, faldas, pantalones y faldas. Una de sus metas es tener su propia tienda en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Hardworking and persevering are characteristics that describe Sayda, a 44-year-old woman. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 12. They are her biggest motivation to work day after day. Sayda earns a living selling used clothing door-to-door. She has worked like this for 18 years. Sayda offers her customers a variety of styles and colors.

Sayda is requesting this loan, her first with this financial institution, in order to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and skirts. One of her goals is to have her own shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and pants.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 73 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children, all of whom are now adults.

Crisanta is engaged in agri-business, particularly in rice production. She's been engaged in these activities for 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from her business.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing four sacks of commercial fertilizers for her rice production business. Crisanta has been a member of PMPC for almost 13 years. In the future, Crisanta hopes to be engaged in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of commercial fertilizers.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a 61-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani Kenya. She is a mother of one and her spouse provides additional income. For the last five years she has been in this business and doing well.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar, milk, tea leaves, and washing detergents for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and expand her business. Mbodze hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar, milk, tea leaves, and washing detergents for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 47 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products, and groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Yolanda Maria

texts.es:
En el Cantón Puerto Quito recinto La Caoni con un clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora se dedican a la producción cacao su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades  en este recinto vive y tiene su negocio la señora Yolanda una mujer luchadora que día a día da su mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante con su  hijo de 5 años ella tiene 25 años es madre soltera. 
La señora Yolanda se dedica a la producción de cacao lo aprendió con ayuda de sus padres ya que siempre vivieron en el campo tiene dos hectáreas de producción le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias ya que también tiene producción de leche tiene entregas seguras es muy conocida en el sector por ser una mujer honesta y sincera.
Doña Yolanda solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para la producción de cacao ya que con esta inversión sus plantas darán una mejor producción y esto hará que tenga mejores ingresos y podrá dar a su hijo un futuro mejor.  
La señora Yolanda agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The Puerto Quito canton, community of La Caoni chas a warm and humid climate. Its people are friendly and hardworking. They grow cacao and are cheerful people who like to enjoy their festivals. This is where Yolanda lives and has her business. She is a hardworking woman who strives day to day to get ahead with her 5 year old son. She is 25 and is a single mother.

Yolanda grows cacao. She learned it with the help of her parents, because they always lived in the country. She has two hectares of cropland and she spends an average of 8 hours a day working, as she also produces milk. She has stable customers and she well known in the area for being an honest and sincere woman.

Yolanda is asking for the loan to buy materials she needs to grow cacao. With this investment, her plants will have a better yield and this will lead to better income so that she can give her son a better future.

Yolanda is grateful to Kiva for the support and the help.

loans.use: to buy materials to grow quality cacao. With this investment, her plants will have a better yield.

loans.name: Rosa Daysi

texts.es:
Rosa, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos. 

Rosa, se dedica a la venta informal de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella sale a las comunidades y pueblos vecinos a vender ropa casual y ropa interior, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo y asegura que lo hace con mucho orgulloso, porque de esa manera ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y darle el estudio a sus hijos. 

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para vender, porque quiere aprovechar la temporada de diciembre porque se vende mucho y de esa manera obtendrá mejores ganancias. 

Los sueños de Rosa, son poder seguir con su negocio y ahorrar para pagar la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45 years old, is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is a single mother and lives with her two children.

Rosa works in informal sales of women's, men's and children's clothing. She goes out to the neighboring communities and towns to sell casual clothing and underwear. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years and affirms that she does it with a lot of pride because in this way she has managed to get ahead with her family and give her children an education.

Rosa needs the loan to purchase clothing to sell because she wants to take advantage of the December season because a lot is sold, and in this way she will get more earnings.

Rosa's dreams are to be able to continue with her business and save up to pay for her children's university education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Armida

texts.es:
Gloria, de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando gracias al esfuerzo de ella. 

Gloria, se dedica al comercio informal de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, las prendas de vestir las vende cerca de su casa y este negocio lo inicio para generar ingresos para que sus hijos tuvieran lo necesario, ya que ella no tuvo ayuda de su pareja y de esa mantiene a su familia. 

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalones, ropa interior y ropa para niños, porque en esta temporada se vende más. 

Los sueños de Gloria, son obtener buenas ganancias en esta temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Gloria, 49 years old, is a single mother. She has 3 children who are going to school thanks to her efforts.

Gloria works in informal sales of women's, men's and children's clothing. She sells the clothing near her house and she began this business to generate income so that her children had what they needed since she didn't have the help of her partner and in this way she supports her family.

Gloria needs the loan to purchase blouses, pants, lingerie, and children's clothing because in this season more is sold.

Gloria's dreams are to have good earnings in this end-of-year season.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, lingerie and children's clothing because in this season more is sold.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José, de 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus dos hijos tienen empleo y ayudan con los gastos en la casa.
 
José, se dedica a la agricultura y este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres y casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a eso, porque desde que tenía doce años cultiva la tierra y anteriormente cultivaba caña y elaboraba dulces artesanales y tenía crianza de cerdos.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaquilla, porque ha cultivado bastante y tiene suficiente pasto para su alimentación.

José, sueña con tener más vacas y producir lácteos.
texts.en:
José, 57 years old, didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He is married, his wife works at the domestic chores and his two children are working and help with the household expenses.

José works in agriculture and he learned this work from his parents and he has worked in this almost his entire life because since he was twelve years old, he cultivated the land and before he grew sugar cane and made artisanal candies and he was raising pigs.

José needs the loan to purchase a calf because he has planted a bit and has enough pasture for its feed.

José dreams of having more cows and to produce dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Arcoiris Del Amor Group
