Pedelisa is a 54-year-old woman with four children, one of whom is in school. Pedelisa is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business, such as spare parts, etc.

Pedelisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business, such as spare parts, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Goya

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Nancy es docente de profesión, a la  vez la socia continua realizando su negocio de tejidos hechos a mano, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su negocio pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas, hilos, tijeras entre otros.
texts.en: Nancy belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco. Nancy is a teacher by profession and also continuing her hand-knitting business. She is a responsible woman and hopes to obtain more earnings through her business so that she can continue supporting her family. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making the payments. She requests a loan to buy wool, thread and scissors, among other things.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Sehila

texts.es:
La socia Sehila continua dedicándose a su tienda de abarrotes, esta labor la realiza arduamente casi todo el día.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar leche, gaseosas, galletas y cereales. Asi podrá ampliar su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a  sus clientes.
La socia está contenta con los inversionistas de KIVA, por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
The member Sehila continues to work in her grocery store. She works hard most of the day.

She is requesting the loan to buy milk, soft drinks, cookies and cereals. Doing this she can expand her business and offer more variety to her clients.

The member is pleased with the Kiva lenders for continuing to have confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, cookies and cereals.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en: Arcadia is 61 years old, married, and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor. She has been a vegetable retailer for over 30 years. This business enables her to help with paying for their household expenses. Recently, she availed herself of a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy more kilos of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children, one of whom is still in school. Victoria is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat, to maintain her business.

Victoria has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat, to maintain her business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 32 years old and married with one child. Ester works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods, and personal care products.

Ester has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell like beverages, sugar, and other groceries.

Edina has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Edina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell like beverages, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia continúa dedicándose al negocio de alquilar carros,  la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su negocio pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en: Pamela belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco. She continues to work in the car rental business. She is a responsible woman and hopes to obtain more earnings through her business so that she can continue supporting her family. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making the payments. She requests a loan to carry out the maintenance of her car.

loans.use: to carry out the maintenance of her car.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic, married with four children, is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she has been growing rice to earn a living for 15 years. A member of PMPC for four years, Marivic is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La socia María Esther pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia María Esther, la socia continua  con su carrera de guía de turismo,  la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su trabajo pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
La socia solicito el crédito para pagar gastos de educación.
texts.en:
The member María Esther belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

The member María Esther continues with her studies to become a tourist guide. She is a responsible woman. She hopes that through her work she will be able to obtain more earnings and in this way continue to support her family. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments.

The member is requesting the loan to pay her education expenses.

loans.use: to pay her education expenses.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is a hardworking mother from Tubod, Aloran, Mis. Occ. She is 62 years old and a business woman who makes copra (dried coconut meat). She buys whole coconuts for this.

Agapita has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance products and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts to make copra. Agapita hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 27 years old and has one child, who is 10 years old. Her husband works as a helper in a gas station and earns a minimum salary. Cecille operates her sari-sari store to help support their daily expenses.

She sells noodles, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits, and other basic items to her community. She wanted to add to her store's stock, to increase her income to help more with their life.

Cecille is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy snack foods, shampoo, laundry soaps, canned goods, and other items as additional merchandise to sell to her customers.

Cecille wants to expand her store in the future to generate more income so that she can save for her child's future education.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, shampoo, laundry soaps, canned goods, and other items as additional merchandise to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 52 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married and has adult-age children.

Veronica owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members for a living. She has been doing this for five years.

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle. Veronica is a new member of PMPC.

In the future, Veronica hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita lives in Pangi, Siquijor and supports her three daughters by building houses from the ground up.

She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material and paints and also to pay her workers.

She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material & paints and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 47 years old.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 59 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is still in school. Cresencia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods, and personal care products.

Cresencia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Janjan

texts.en:
Janjan is 23 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Janjan has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado, se dedica al cuidado de sus dos niños de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor va a primer grado y la menor aun no asiste a la escuela. 

Carlos, tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace 5 años y tiene experiencia de 15 años porque sus padres lo pusieron a trabajar en un taller de pinturas de vehículos y ahí obtuvo el conocimiento que ahora tiene; pero aparte de eso también se encarga de ir a dejar pan a una panadería de 4:00 a.m. a 7:00 a.m. y el taller lo atiende de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. 

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar equipo de trabajo y una maquina para rubiniar las pinturas de los vehículos y un tecle como condensador.

Carlos, sueña con poder tener el taller y muy bien organizado con todas las herramientas que necesita y poder comprar un pequeño lote para construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, 39 years old, went to school up to the seventh grade, is partnered, she works taking care of their two children, ages 7 and 3. The older one is in first grade and the younger one doesn't go to school yet.

Carlos has had a body shop for 5 years and has 15 years of experience because his parents had him work in a vehicle paint shop and there he got the knowledge he now has. But, apart from this, he also is responsible to go bring bread to a bakery from 4:00 am to 7:00 am and he works in the shop from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

Carlos needs the loan to purchase work equipment and a machine to buff the paint on the vehicles and a chain hoist for the condenser.

Carlos dreams of being able to have a shop and be very well organized with all the tools that he needs and to be able to purchase a small plot to build his house.

loans.use: to purchase work equipment and a machine to buff the paint on the vehicles and a chain hoist for the condenser.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio Javier pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
El socio sigue trabajando en  una institución pública, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, el socio es una persona responsable el cual espera mediante su  trabajo poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, a la vez él socio también sigue dedicándose a su negocio  de pasamanería.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de cremas, pasta dental entre otros y para bienes de consumo.
texts.en:
The member Javier belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

He continues to work for a public institution. He feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of his installments. He is a responsible person who hopes that he can obtain more earnings through his work and in this way be able to continue to support his family. At the same time he is also continuing his passmenterie business (making decorative objects with cords and tassels).

The member is requesting the loan to buy creams and tooth paste amongst others and for consumer goods.

loans.use: to buy creams and tooth paste amongst others and for consumer goods.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is managing her eatery business in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been working well to support the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children who are now adults. Alicia earns her living from fishing and from ice vending business activities.

She has been in these businesses for more than 30 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month through her work.

She has requested a loan to purchase one brand new boat engine for her fishing boat. Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 9 years already. In the future, Alicia hopes to become one of the major fish wholesalers in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Godilla

texts.en:
Godilla learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Mohon, Aloran, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her corn production.

After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Godilla feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to jump start her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Godilla wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Godoberta

texts.en: Godoberta is a known fish vendor in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time in selling fish. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. The reason why she availed herself of another loan from PMPC was to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 56 years old. She is known in the Dullan, Aloran, area for her sari-sari store. She actively participates in the various programs and services that the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and boards. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and boards for her house.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 55 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children, now in their college years.

Elsie has been engaged in hog fattening and food processing activities, particularly toccino and longganisa, for 7 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan to be used to pay the tuition fees of her college student children.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her hog fattening and food processing business.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a mother of two school-aged children and has run a motor transport business with her husband as a driver for the past nine years. Her business involves motor for hire or public transport. She does this work to support her children.

She asked for a loan to purchase another motor unit. Owning another one will increase her income and would ensure she will be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase another motor unit.

loans.name: Ifugenia

texts.en:
Ifugenia is a married woman. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells ballast. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are house builders.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more ballast. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more ballast.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and has four children. Evangeline is single and has three children who are presently in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is 23 years old and single. She has one child.

Ma. Isabel is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ma. Isabel has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Isabel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years.

He has been recruiting skilled people to do embroidery work for daily wages, and he also brings some materials home for Razia, because she helps him with the embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession, and he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his artistry and appreciate his efforts.

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance for his inventory. He requires some capital to buy the desired materials, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Razia has humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors that he needs. Razia is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for his embroidery business.

loans.name: Mercedes Maria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sucre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual  estudian en una escuela de la localidad. El marido es chofer.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para salir adelante, ella  se dedica a la venta de productos de Leudine (productos de belleza, cosméticos, medicina natural, entre otra gran variedad de productos). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella realiza sus recorridos  todos los días ya que así se entretiene visitando sus clientes que siempre le compran sus productos, ella deja a crédito y cobra  cada semana. Lleva más de 2 años con este negocio con el cual se gana algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para comprar tratamientos, cosméticos, medicinas naturales, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a su hijo.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the "Grupo De Crédito Sucre" gets together in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and craftwork, which is recognized at the national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats. Mercedes, 27, lives in this place and maintains a free union relationship, from which she has a 6-year-old child who studies in the town's school. Her partner is a driver. 

Mercedes is a woman that has always liked making a living to get ahead, and she works in the sale of Leudine products, (beauty products, cosmetics and natural medicine, among a large variety of products). The way she sells is door to door and she makes her rounds every day, as she has fun visiting her customers that always purchase her products. She allows purchases on credit and gets paid every week. She has spent more than two years in this business which allows her to earn something on her own. 

This loan is to purchase treatments, cosmetics and natural medicine, among other things that she sells. She has spent more than five years with the "Grupo De Crédito Sucre" and she likes it for helping with the loans. Her dream is give the best to her child.

loans.use: to purchase treatments, cosmetics, natural medicine, etc.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 54 years old and lives in Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children, 2 of whom are now of school age and one of whom is an adult.

Luzminda is engaged in a dried fish vending business during “tabo” or market day, particularly in Pagadian City. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity, from which the said amount is so helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of dried fish for resale.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Luzminda hopes to become a major dried fish dealer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Eva is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rotchel

texts.en:
Rotchel is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rotchel is 31 years old and has one child still in school.

Rotchel has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Rotchel requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of vegetables like onions, garlic, carrots, cabbage and etc to sell in her local market.

Rotchel has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of vegetables like onions, garlic, carrots, cabbage and other things to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 58 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods and other personal care products.

Ruby has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Ruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to resell at her general store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 47, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Grace has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Grace has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with five children. She is 49 years old and one of her children is in school.

Rowena is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children. Two of them are still in school and the other one is grown-up. She has been a food vendor for nine years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwajabu's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing the food stock and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support they provide to her group.

She used the profit to pay school fees, to pay for loan dues, to reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the food stock and serve more customers. She dreams of promoting her business to reach the targeted customers.

Mwajabu will share this loan with her loan group "Ulezi," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the food stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Velinda

texts.en:
Velinda is 22 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their school and infant age.

Velinda earns her living from processed food vending, particularly longganisa (pork sausage). She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional longganisa to sell.

She's been in the business for more than two years already. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 1,000 from doing this type of business.

Velinda has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her processed foods vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional longganisa (pork sausage) to sell.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.en:
Amadeo is 50 years old, and single. He lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City.

Amadeo is engaged in a multi-level marketing business where he sells various wellness products. He makes good sales on his chosen business and earns sufficient profit to support his needs. This time he needs to buy additional stock of personal wellness products for his networking business and he asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for networking business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 51 years old and married with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Charito has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 47 years old and has seven children. Florida is married and has two children who are in school.

Florida is in the agricultural business raising pis in the Philippines. Florida requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florida has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Florida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Annamaria is in her early 20's and is single with one child in school. She has been running a beauty salon for three years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Annamaria's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of expanding her salon business.

Annamaria will share this loan with her loan group Kimanga, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 72 years old, single and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC where she access financial assistance for her personal use. She also enjoys the perks of membership. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 31 years old. She is married to Thomas and blessed with two children aged 16 and 9 years old. She has been in a shop business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is her second loan with VFK, she intends to pay school fees for her children. She anticipates saving even more with VFK so that in future she may borrow a bigger loan to help her expand the business.

Her future dreams are to be wealthy and have well-educated children.

loans.use: to purchase shop items.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Tabita is a 56-year-old widow with 2 children. She resides in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Tabita owns and operates a small retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business.

Tabita requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a computer set to start a new business, an internet cafe. In 2009 Tabita joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to allow her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a computer set for her new business.

loans.name: Mwanapole

texts.en:
Mwanapole is a single woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of dresses. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dresses.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 38 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Belinda has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 52 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Felicitas has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio lives in Palayan, Aloran and supports his three daughters by building houses from the ground up.

He has successfully repaid his whole loan, which he used to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He wants his daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a forty-six-year-old man, married and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management trainings.

He is a tailor and is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand his business by buying more tailoring materials. This will enable him to meet his customer’s demands hence earning more income. He says that this income will help him support basic family needs such as food and paying for his children’s education

Bernard is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and meet his customers demands hence earn more income to support his family's needs such as food and the children's education.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, biscuits, coffee, and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, biscuits, coffee, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and married with three children. She divides her time between taking care of her husband, who suffered a stroke, and operating her sari-sari store (small grocery store).

Lolita's store is popular because it’s located in front of the street. She wanted to expand it to add more merchandise since her customers are asking for items and products she cannot supply due to lack of capital.

Lolita is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy one box of canned goods, one box of noodles, eggs, electronic load, and other groceries she can sell in her store.

Lolita wants to became a wholesaler in the future to generate more income to pay for her family expenses, especially the education of her children and the maintenance medication that her husband needs.

loans.use: to buy one box of canned goods, one box of noodles, eggs, electronic load, and other groceries she can sell in her store.

loans.name: Maris

texts.en: Maris is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Maular, Aloran. She is supported by her husband who works abroad. She wants to renovate her house so she asked for a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She will use her loan to purchase bags of cement, hollow blocks, plywood, and other materials to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, hollow blocks, plywood, and other materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a businesswoman from Maular, Aloran. She is 47 years old and married, and she has expertise in retailing. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a small income that sufficiently supports her family. Rebecca is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans previously. She maintains her membership in good standing and has never defaulted. She applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rebecca continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Modelyn

texts.en: Modelyn operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Hickel

texts.en: Hickel is a strong willed man who will do anything for his family. He is 35 years old, married and lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. He operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives him quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000.00 that sufficiently provides the needs of his family. Recently, he avails another loan to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Ivy Fronda

texts.en:
Ivy Fronda is 36 years old, married and had a child. She is managing a stall selling ukay-ukay"used clothes" to sell. She wanted to keep selling more merchandise and earn enough profits to save for her family. Ivy is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to invest in her business. 

In the future, Ivy Fronda hopes to continue managing her business and gain good profits to save fund for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of ukay-ukay (used clothes) to re-sell.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en: Marigen is 44 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children.  Marigen earns her living from sales on catering, eatery business and sari-sari store. She earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fees of her daughter. Marigen has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Marigen hopes to expand her catering and eatery business.

loans.use: to be used in paying the tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 66 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children who are now at their adult age. Elsa earns her living from ice making and retailing business for 13 years already and earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in paying her electric bills and to purchase additional cellophane wrappers for her business. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for almost 15 years. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her ice making and retailing businesses.

loans.use: to be used in paying her electric bills and to purchase additional cellophane wrappers .

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Florenda is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 55 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 adult-aged children. To earn her living, Liberty has a paper bag making business. She also receives support from her husband abroad.

Liberty earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional paper and other accessories for her paper bag making business.

Liberty has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her paper bag making business to other municipalities.

loans.use: to purchase additional paper and other accessories.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy another cow. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale farm and a stable business.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 37 years old married to Eunice and blessed with eight children aged between 15 and 2 years old.

He has been into transportation and shop business business for ten years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.35,000.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya,he intends to buy a new motorcycle for transportation business in within his village.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able  to repay his loan and service his motorcycles.

His future dreams are to buy a 14 seater passenger vehicle as well as educating his children.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transportation business in within his village

loans.name: Aniliza

texts.en: Aniliza, is aged 47, and a single mother. She owns and manages a transportation business in their village for almost six months and earns PHP 5,000 every month on this business. Due to inadequate capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcyle. Aniliza also manages a hog raising business to generate more income to sustain their needs. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon started her small business and became her own boss with her sari-sari store. She manages to have enough inventory and uses her capital to gain more profits.

Every day Corazon makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently, she approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities.

In the future, Corazon hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 25 years old, married to Bilhah, and blessed with two children of five and two years respectively. He has been selling foodstuffs for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000.

This being his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, he intends to buy additional stock of retail household goods for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Paul will be able to make more savings for his children's school fees as well as repay his loan. He dreams of having a supermarket in the town in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of retail household goods for resale

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 25 years old, he operates motorcycle offering transport to people at Mariakani Kenya. He is a father of one who has been in this business for the last four years doing well.

This is his fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after successfully repaying the previous ones. He will use the requested money to to add to his savings and purchase second motorcycle for his business expansion. He hopes to own several motorcycles in future.

loans.use: to add to his savings and purchase second motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and married. She has four children, who are all in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it. In the future,she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Guadalupe continua trabajando como asistente administrativa de obra, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su trabajo pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, la socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de  víveres para su hogar.
texts.en:
Guadalupe belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco.
She continues to work as an administrative assistant. She is a responsible woman, and she hopes that this job will allow her to earn more income in order to keep supporting her family. Guadalupe feels grateful for this loan, and she pledges to make the payments. She requested this loan in order to buy food staples for her home.

loans.use: to buy food staples for her home.

loans.name: Rheza Joy

texts.en:
Rheza Joy is 21 years old, single, and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a fish vendor in one of the local wet markets. She does this in order to support her family's needs. She makes good sales from her business.

Because she wants to live in a well-lit home, Rheza Joy has approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a loan to pay for the installation of electricity in her home.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity.

loans.name: Lolita Juliet

texts.en:
Lolita Juliet is 57 years old and resides at San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with adult-age children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op.

Recently, she's accessing her sixth loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, for additional working capital for her existing business, to buy a variety of commodities. She is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 36 years old. He is married to Nancy and they are blessed with 4 children aged between 14 and 3 years.

Emmanuel has been running his pool and barbershop business for 9 years, and he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he intends to buy shaving machines and renovate his pool table.

Emmanuel hopes to open a business for his wife with his increased business profits. He dreams of enjoying a life of abundance and saving for his children.

loans.use: to renovate his pool table and buy more shaving machines.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una socia trabajadora y emprendedora ella continua dedicándose a vender productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a este negocio sale adelante junto con su hogar.
Todos los días ella se dedica a su negocio con el fin de cumplir sus metas, y ampliar su negocio.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar fideos, arroz y cereales.
Delia esta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y darle la oportunidad de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Delia is a hard-working and enterprising member who continues to make a living selling basic necessities. Thanks to her business she is able to provide for herself and her home.

Everyday she works at her business with the aim of reaching her goals and expanding her business. She asked for the loan to buy noodles, rice, and cereals.

Delia is grateful to Kiva’s investors for continuing to trust in her and giving her the opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, and cereals.

loans.name: Romilyn

texts.en:
Romilyn is driven by passion for selling. She is 27 years old, married, and from Danao, Plaridel where she runs a store that is the primary support for her family. She never tires of tending her store.

Romilyn is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Mulit-Purpose Cooperative, and she has taken several loans already. She has religiously repaid her obligations without any record of default.

Now, Romilyn has taken another loan so she can pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory on hand would mean income opportunities. She dreams of sustaining her store so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Pakiza

texts.en:
Pakiza is a farmer. She has been in the animal breeding business for many years.

Pakiza and her husband are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Now, they are living in the Mahmudlu village of the Fuzuli region. Pakiza has cows, and she is a very hardworking person. She sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc.), and sells those products in the local bazaar.

She has applied to Komak. She needs her third loan in the amount of 2,150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She wants to build a stall for her cows.

She is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help.

loans.use: to build a stall for her cows

loans.name: Hatun Rumiyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Melina continua con su negocio de venta de cosméticos como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros,   la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su trabajo pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, la socia sigue vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank Hatun Rumiyoc. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member, Melina, continues with her business selling cosmetics, such as creams, perfumes and colognes, among other things. The member is a responsible woman, and she hopes that through her work she can earn more to be able to continue supporting her family. 

The member is thankful for the loan and is committed to making the payments. The member continues selling to her customers that request her, and in this way she helps her family get ahead. The member requests a loan for the purchase of perfumes, among other things. 

The members which appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work reasons. The other members appreciate the awarded loan and are committed to comply with their established payments.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, among other things.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha continua dedicándose a enseñar a niños de primaria, ella comparte sus conocimientos con las futuras generación y es muy empeñosa en su labor.
La socia desea comprar víveres para su hogar ya que en estas fiestas de fin de año, quiere tener en su hogar todo lo necesario para su familia. 
Bertha solicito el préstamo para comprar leche , menestras y azúcar.
La socia está contenta con el préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA, por seguir confiando en  ella.
texts.en:
The member Bertha continues to make a living teaching children in elementary school. She shares her knowledge with the future generations and is very diligent in her work.

The member wants to buy food for her home. During the New Year’s celebrations she wants to have everything that her family needs at home.

Bertha asked for the loan to buy milk, legumes, and sugar.

The member is happy with the loan and is thankful to Kiva’s investors for continuing to trust in her.

loans.use: to buy milk, legumes, and sugar.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie never gets tired of tending to her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, for she owns the only store in the place.

She is making good sales in her business, and sufficiently supports the needs of her family. She needs additional capital to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

She seeks a loan from Paglaum MPC, where Tessie is an active member.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and other products.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as kind.

She operates a retail business, where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is an active member of Paglaum MPC, who enjoys all the perks of a member. She is 74 years old and married with adult age children.

She said she's secured financially, knowing she can always turn to the cooperative. However, she wants to be prepared also for unforeseen life events, so she also avails herself of life insurance from the coop.

Now that her one year life insurance policy is expiring, she needs a loan in an amount sufficient to pay for a life insurance renewal for the family. Alicia believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held in a bind by unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for a life insurance renewal for the family.

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es:
Silvia, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, actualmente está trabajando en una relojería de lunes a sábado y los domingo hasta las 12:00 m.d.

Silvia, esta trabajando en una relojería y venta de celulares hace dos años, pero también tiene su propia venta de celulares y relojes, ella decidió comprar otros accesorios para celulares para obtener otros ingresos económicos.

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para comprar más artículos para celulares, porque en esta temporada quiere tener más variedad, para vender más. 

El sueño de Silvia, es tener su propio local y vender otro tipo de artículos que buscan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia is 25 years old. She studied up to high school. She is single and she is working in a clock and watch shop from Monday to Saturday and on Sundays until noon.

Silvia has been working in a clock, watch and cell phone store for two years, but she also has her own sales of cell phones and watches. She decided to buy other accessories for cell phones in order to have other economic earnings.

Sivia needs the loan to buy more items for cell phones because in this season she wants to have more variety in order to sell more.

Silvia's dream is to have her own place of business and to sell other types of items that her customers look for.

loans.use: to buy more items for mobile phones

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is 49 years old and married with school age children. He engages in the agrivet supply business. His business is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC, where he is an active

He has successfully expanded his business, and caters to its costumers with varieties of agrivet supplies. Recently, he asked for a loan from the cooperative to buy additional inventories of animal feeds and other veterinary products to sell.

Roy has high hopes that he will be more successful in his chosen business, and open another branch selling agrivet supplies in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of animal feeds and other veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Florepis

texts.en:
Florepis is 49 years old and has school-age children. She personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC almost three years ago, she has been a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 14,900 for the purchase of new nets.

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay is always enthusiastic about farming. He cultivates rice land in Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, and has enjoyed good earnings doing this work. Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Jay knows that he has to get things right to generate more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Flor Esmeralda

texts.es:
Flor, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, su pareja es albañil y tiene tres hijos que son menores de edad y viven en casa propia.

Flor, desde pequeña se ha dedicado a vender mangos todos los días, pero también su esposo tiene 
crianza de cerdos en su casa, los cuales engorda y luego los vende y su hijo le apoya en cuidarlos cerdos.

Flor, necesita el préstamo para comprar más cerdos pequeños para crecerlos y luego venderlos, de esa manera logrará tener otros ingresos económicos, para mejorar la vida de sus hijos.

Flor, sueña con que sus hijos crezcan en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 26 years old and studied up to the 4th grade. Her companion is a bricklayer and she has three children who are young. They live in their own home.

Since she was a young girl, Flor has made a living selling mangos every day, but her husband also raises pigs at home. He fattens them and then sells them and her son helps him take care of the pigs.

Flor needs the loan to buy more piglets to raise and then sell. That way, she will get added economic income to improve the lives of her children.

Flor dreams of her children growing up in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Nahum Eleazar

texts.es:
Nahúm, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de edad, su pareja solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Nahum, es agricultor desde muy pequeño, porque toda su familia se dedicaba a trabajar en el campo.

Nahum, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado para repasto, porque siempre le ha gustado trabajar con ganado, pero también destinará una parte del préstamo para cultivar maíz.

Nahum, sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos y que sean personas profesionales.
texts.en:
Nahúm, who is 23 years old, went to school through secondary school. He is married and has a four-month-old son. His wife does only the domestic tasks.

Nahúm has been a farmer since he was very young, because his entire family works in the fields.

Nahúm needs the loan to buy cattle to pasture, because he has always liked to work with cattle, but he will also direct a part of the loan to raising corn.

Nahúm dreams of seeing his children grow and become professional people.

loans.use: to buy cattle to pasture.

loans.name: Estanislao Margarito

texts.es: Estanislao es un hombre trabajador que vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, a los que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor. Él cuenta con 43 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios de motorista tanto a nivel nacional como en el área centroamericana, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, pero no logra pasar mucho tiempo con ellos. Actualmente Estanislao no cuenta con una vivienda propia para brindar a su familia, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita construir su vivienda propia y segura y para ello comprará: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además de lámina para el techo y cumplir su sueño de vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Estaislao is a hard-working man who lives with his life companion and his son, to whom he always seeks a way to offer the best. He is 43 years old and works as a driver, at both a national level as well as in the area of Central America; this allows him to support his family, but he doesn't manage to spend much time with them.

At this time Estanislao doesn't have his own home to offer to his family, and for this reason he has decided to apply to FUSAI for a loan that will allow him to build a secure house of his own. To do this, he will buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron, as well as metal sheeting for the roof, and to achieve his dream of his own home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron, as well as metal sheeting for the roof, and to achieve his dream of his own house.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven aprendió del arte de construcción de vivienda, lo cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 25 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que buscan de sus servicios. Él a sus 58 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 21 años de edad, al que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Francisco desea continuar brindando servicios de calidad a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en herramientas de trabajo como: tenazas, cucharas para cemento, almágana, martillos, entre otros necesarios para continuar dando servicios de albañil de calidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is a hard-working man who, from the time he was young, learned the art of house construction, which has permitted him to support his family for 25 years. Thus, he has a large quantity of clients who look for his services. At his 58 years of age, he lives with his life partner and 21-year-old son whom, with much effort, he has managed to raise and provide for.

Francisco wishes to continue providing quality services to his clients. Thus, he is requesting a FUSAI loan which he will invest in work tools such as pliers, cement trowels, sledge hammer and carpenter hammers among other items necessary in order to continue providing quality construction services.

loans.use: to buy tools for work such as pliers, cement trowels, sledge hammer and carpenter hammers among other items necessary to continue providing quality construction services

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y sus hijos estudian bachillerato.

José, se dedica a la construcción y cuando es época de lluvia trabaja en la siembra de maíz, este tipo de trabajo lo aprendió de su padre.

José, necesita el préstamo para pagar mozos para cortar la cosecha de maíz.
José, sueña con seguir trabajando y darles la oportunidad a sus hijos de que estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
José is 53 years of age and studied until second grade. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household chores and his children are in high school. 

José works in construction, and during the rainy season he works sowing corn. He learned this type of work from his father. José needs this loan to pay workers to harvest the corn. José dreams of continuing to work and giving his children the opportunity to study in the university.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest the corn.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, de 49 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una empresa distribuidora de agua y tienen tres hijos mayores de edad.

Ana, se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa, sus hijos y su pareja le ayudan económicamente para la 
alimentación y otros gastos que tiene en casa.

Ana, necesita le préstamo para comprar una cocina artesanal para vender pasteles de carne y papitas fritas, porque quiere generar más ingresos para ayudar con las necesidades de su casa.

Ana, sueña con ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 49 years old, did not go to school. She is married, and her partner works in a water-distributing business. They have three adult children.

Ana does the domestic tasks in their house. Her children and her husband help economically for food and the other household expenses.

Ana needs the loan to buy a traditional stove in order to sell meat pastries and fried potatoes, because she wants to generate more income to help with the household necessities.

Ana dreams of helping her children go to school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a traditional stove in order to sell meat pastries and fried potatoes.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, está acompañada, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en su casa. 

Catalina, se dedica a la venta de tortas en un puesto que tiene en su casa, tiene varios años dedicándose a eso y la gente de su pueblo la conoce muy bien y aseguran que son las mejores tortas de todo su pueblo; ella está muy contenta con su negocio, porque gracias a el ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y les ha podido dar lo necesario a sus hijos. 

Catalina, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vitrina hermética, para poder mantener calientes los ingredientes de sus tortas y para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las tortas, porque se acercan las fiestas de su pueblo y todos los años las tortas tienen mucha demanda. 

Los sueños de Catalina, son poder ahorrar y seguir con su negocio y buscar un local para poner su negocio en el propio centro del pueblo.
texts.en:
Catalina is 51 years old. She is a very determined and hard-working woman. She has a live-in partner and two children who live with her in her house.

Catalina works selling tortas [meat sandwiches] from a sales stand she operates in her house. She has done this work for several years, and the people of her small town know her very well and declare that hers are the best tortas in town. She is very happy about her business, because thanks to it she has been able to get ahead with her family and give her children what they need.

Catalina needs the loan to buy an insulated case so she can keep the ingredients for her tortas hot, and also to buy supplies to make her tortas, because the village festival days are approaching, and there is great demand every year for her tortas.

Catalina's dreams are to be able to accumulate some savings, continue with her business and look for a permanent space where she can set up her business in the center of town.

loans.use: to buy an insulated case for her sandwich ingredients.

loans.name: Santos Sotera

texts.es:
Santos, de 54 años de edad, no estudio, es viuda, su esposo falleció hace varios años y vive con sus dos hijos.

Santos, hace varios años elabora hamacas y matatas, después que si esposo falleció ella busco la manera de generar ingresos para mantener a sus hijos y este fue el oficio que le ha ayudado a lograrlo, pero ahora ellos trabajan de lo mismo para ayudarle a ella. 

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar hijo para elaborar las hamacas, porque tiene varios encargos y no tiene el material.

El sueño de Santos es, tener suficiente materiales para no dejar de trabajar y siempre tener las fuerzas para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Santos is 54 years old, did not attend school, and is a widow; her husband passed away several years ago. She lives with her two children.

For several years Santos has made hammocks and canvas bags. After her husband passed, she searched for a way to generate income in order to support her children, and this was the job that helped her achieve this; but now they do the same work in order to help her.

Santos needs the loan in order to buy thread for making hammocks because she has several orders and does not have the material.

Santos' dream is to have enough materials to keep working and to always have the strength for doing so.

loans.use: to buy thread for making hammocks because she has several orders and does not have the material.

loans.name: Ascencion Del Trancito

texts.es: Ascencio es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de típicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 29 años con el apoyo de su compañera de vida, por lo que se siente muy feliz, ya que este negocio permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Él vive con su compañera de vida en casa de su propiedad a sus 69 años de edad él cuenta con vivienda propia en la que habita desde hace 22 años. Ascencio desea invertir en su negocio, ya que por la zona en la que se encuentra su negocio él cuenta con muchos clientes, por lo que está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en materia prima para su venta de típicos.
texts.en:
Ascencio is a very hard-working man who makes his living preparing and selling traditional dishes. He has been in this business for 29 years, with the support of his life companion and he feels very happy, because this business allows him to maintain his household budget. He lives with his life companion in a house that he owns. At age 69, he has his own home that he has lived in since he was 22 years old.

Ascencio wants to invest in his business, because thanks to the area where it's located, he has many customers. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in raw materials for his business selling traditional treats.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for his business selling traditional treats.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo vive en una comunidad de Trojes al oriente de Honduras, tiene 63 años de edad y es padre de 3 hijos, vive con su esposa y su fuente principal de ingresos es la caficultura.
Don Gerardo solicita el prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes, para lograr una mejor cosecha y alargarle la vida a sus cultivos, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es exportar su producto y que este sea de muy buena calidad.

Trojes, Honduras - Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Señor Gerardo lives in a community of Trojes in west Honduras. He is 63 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his wife, and his main source of income is coffee growing.

Don Gerardo asks for the loan in order to buy fertilizer so that he can achieve a better harvest and extend the life of his crops. He hopes that this investment will allow him to succeed with his business and to continue to support his family.

One of his dreams is to export his product and for it to be of very good quality.

Trojes, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of two children, both of them still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life.  He is a soldier in the Lebanese army. Despite the bad financial situation, she is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s registration fees for the coming school, which makes her very happy and optimistic.

loans.use: to pay her children’s registration fees

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Pablo es un hombre trabajador de 51 años de edad que se dedica a la prestar sus servicios de jornalero, además cuenta con el apoyo de su compañera de vida que se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir. Él vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su hijo de 18 años de edad al que han sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Pablo desea construir un cuarto dentro de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía él ha separado su vivienda con cortinas, por lo que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pablo is a hard-working man of 51 who works providing services as a day laborer. He also has the support of his life partner, who works making clothing. He lives in his own house together with his wife and his 18-year-old son, whom he has raised and supported with great effort.

Pablo wants to build a room within his home, since as can be seen in the photo, his house is currently divided with curtains. For that reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron rods to build a room within his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron rods to build a room inside his home.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 34 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. Juliet has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Iduvina Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Iduvina  es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio, tiene una hija que depende de ella,  cuenta con un comedor  y su venta la realiza todos los días de la semana, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia de dedicarse a este negocio, sus clientes son amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Iduvina vende desayunos, almuerzos, cenas, solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne de res, pollo, manteca, papas, condimentos para la carne, refrescos,  chuleta, etc. esto es para seguir elaborando comidas porque se acerca la temporada cafetalera y en ese tiempo las ventas son aun mejor,.
Doña Iduvina sueño es que su hija pueda seguir estudiando.

Danli, Honduras – Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Iduvina is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her own business. She has a daughter that depends on her. She runs a diningroom and sells ever day all week. She has 5 years of experience earning a living from this business. Her customers are friends and neighbors from her community.

Iduvina sells breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. She is requesting a loan to buy beef, chicken, lard, potatoes, condiments for the meat, soft drinks, pork chops, etc. so she can continue to prepare meals, because the season for the coffee harvest is approaching and her sales during that period are even better.

Iduvina's dream is that her daughter can continue studying.

Danli, Honduras – October 2015

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, lard, potatoes, condiments for the meat, soft drinks, pork chops, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bimke

texts.en:
Bimke is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be humble.

She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Mailan

texts.en:
Mailan has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting as well as earning income. Mailan has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Mailan has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.
