Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Mailan hopes to purchase another piece of rice land to cultivate, which will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds for good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Riandegwa Maendeleo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising the hand in this photo is Esther, married and a mother of three children. She is a member of Riandegwa Maendeleo Women group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in the year 2014 and has successfully undergone enterprise development and financial management training in HiH-EA.

Esther’s economic enterprise is pig rearing and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy feeds and more piglets to help expand her farming activities.She looks forward to more income, thus providing better clothing and food for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy feeds and more piglets to help expand her farming activities

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for her previous loan. She was able to restock her grocery shop with fruit and vegetables. This enabled her to pay part of her children's school fees. Her grocery store has expanded and she requests a second Kiva loan to rent a bigger business premise.   This will further increase income levels and enable her continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Kissanga A Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her late 30's, is a widow with three schooling children. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 6 AM to 5 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salma’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing wonders.

She used the profit to pay school fees for her children, to repay the loan, to reinvest in business, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the food stock and sell to more customers. She dreams of expending her business to a hotel.

Salma will share this loan with her group, Kissanga, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the food stock and sell to more customers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 25 years old and she lives in a small town in Pana-on. She got married young and was blessed with two children. Her husband is a laborer in a nearby town. To help her husband earn a living, she has been running a retail business for one year. Leonora and her husband strive hard to earn a living for them to continue to send their children to school and to support the family needs. Leonora has repaid her previous loan successfully and now she plans to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her small store and to start a new business: swine fattening. She plans to have a grocery store someday, if God will permit.

loans.use: to buy additonal goods for her retail business and to use for the start-up capital for swine fattening.

loans.name: Esterlito

texts.en:
Esterlito is a 71-year-old married businessman from Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena.

He runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family. Esterlito is a full fledged member of PMPC and has had several previous loans. He maintains his membership in good standing. He needs a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other items. Esterlito continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna has mastered her farming business in Balanlinao, Plaridel to make a living and support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to have credit to fully support her business. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing to finance any needs. The loan of 7,600 PHP will be used to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

April has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, spices, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Edmundo

texts.es: Don Rafael, Tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos en una aldea de Morazán, Yoro. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno desde hace 10 años. Anteriormente él se dedicaba al comercio de granos básicos y producción de maíz. Pero la cría y engorde de ganado vacuno ha sido más rentable para obtener mejores ganancias. Ha solicitado varios préstamos anteriores para su actividad, actualmente solicita el octavo ciclo en la institución que es por 15,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de dos terneros para engorde y para la producción y venta de carne. Considera que este otro préstamo le ayudara a tener buenos ingresos e incrementar su producción en el próximo ciclo. Su meta es duplicar su cantidad de ganado para poderles dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Don Rafael is 53 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a small village in Morazán, Yoro. He has made a living by raising cattle for ten years. Previously, he made a living by selling basic grains and through corn production. But raising and fattening cattle has been more profitable for getting better income.

He has solicited several previous loans for his job; now he is requesting his eighth loan cycle with the institution. It is for 15,000 Lempiras so that he can invest in the purchase of two calves to fatten and use for the production and sale of meat. He says that this eighth loan will help him get good income and increase his production in the next cycle.

His goal is to double his quantity of cattle so that he can provide a better way of life for his family and his children can continue attending school.

loans.use: to buy two calves to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ngwatano Ya Aka Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is L59-year-old Lydia. She is married and has seven children. She is a member of 'Ngwatanio ya aka' group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. They received training on enterprise and financial management.

Lydia operates a café to earn a living. She will use the loan from Kiva to buy flour, cooking oil, and vegetables to expand her business. She intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, and vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a 47-year-old married woman with 12 children ranging in age from 29 to 3 years old.

Nerissa and her husband operate a fishing business as their only source of income for their family's daily expenses.

Nerissa has been selling fish for 5 years and her husband has fished for 20 years.

Nerissa is requesting 6,000 PHP to buy bangus (milk fish), tilapia, anchovies, and other fish that her husband cannot catch.

Nerissa wants to expand her stall and add more fish to increase her income to help provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 31-year-old married man with five. Fifteen years ago, he left school and started working in the construction field specialized in flooring to cover his needs and expenses. He is experienced and is well-known for his professional skills.

After the Syrian war began, Ismail started working harder to better satisfy his family's needs in Syria. Unfortunately, Ismail's income is still not enough and needs a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to support his family's education, food, and housing needs.

Ismail hopes to develop his business in the future, increase his income, and satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: to support his family's living.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en: Hind is a married 48-year-old Lebanese woman who has three children. Two years ago, and with the aim of supplementing her husband's income, she started producing homemade food to sell. Hind requests a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase agricultural products and food provisions. She is a very positive person who always seeks the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and food provisions.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. Jocelyn has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children now at their adult age.

Elena has been engaged in managing her own sari-sari store business for 11 years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity in which the said amount is so helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to purchase two additional sacks of rice and groceries for retail.

Elena has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase two additional sacks of rice and groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina lives in the town of Pana-on. She is a 36-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her husband works abroad to satisfy the needs of the family. Is income fluctuates and she has to find ways to earn extra money.

She started a “rent a motorcycle” business. The money that she used to buy the motorcycle came from the loan granted by GDMPC last year. She successfully repaid the loan. She plans to renew the loan to buy another motorcycle and open a retail store. Gina hopes to become a motorcycle operator in her town and wishes to have a big grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle and to buy goods for a retail business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa makes a living operating a sari-sari store (convenience store) in Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte and earns a promising income to support her family. She has joined PMPC to gain access to funds to increase her inventory.

She will use the loan to buy canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. Marissa hopes to sustain her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, coffee and also keeps dairy cows. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop pests and animal diseases. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm supplies. Her business goal is to increase milk production within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Philibus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Philibus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Philibus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 52 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristita has a general store in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, spices, soap and other groceries to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, spices, soap and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margiolina

texts.en:
Margiolina is 50 years old, and she is married with 6 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Margiolina runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, noodles, and school supplies, as well as other groceries.

In the future, Margiolina would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge proviene de una familia muy trabajadora, vive con sus abuelos  quienes ya son de edad muy avanzada a quienes él cuida, estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino.
Es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante y poder crecer. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jorge comes from a very hardworking family. He lives with his grandparents, who are very advanced in age, and of whom he takes care. He studies business administration and through his education he wants to open new paths for himself.
He is a very selfless person who wants to get ahead and be able to grow. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay tuition for his program and in this way be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Kissanga  B Group

texts.en:
Rahimu, who is in his early 30s, is married with 2 children, one of whom is still in school while the other is still small. He has been running an electrical welding business for 10 years now. He works from 6.30 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rahimu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy welding products, and he has managed to successfully repay all of his loans. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great. He used his profits to pay school fees, take care of his family, repay loans, reinvest in his business, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy metal pipes to make doors and widows. He dreams of expanding his business.

Rahimu will share this loan with his loan group Kissanga B which has 4 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy metal pipes to make doors and widows.

loans.name: Lino

texts.en: Lino believes education is a key to success in life. He wants his children to earn a degree and become successful in whatever field they choose. Lino wants to help his family and his children to finish their education. With the loan of PHP 6,000, he will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and graduation costs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita has been making good sales on her cosmetics and beauty products so she wants to exploit the opportunity of making good fortune out of it. She signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and availed herself of a loan product in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase stock of cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma  wants to prepare for the upcoming growing season and prepare her seedbeds. She will use the loan from the Cooperative to buy fertilizer. Wilma hopes to save enough money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 26 year old single lady blessed with a child.

She has been in business for 4 years now and it has been profitable.

She has borrowed a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy clothing materials and kente prints of different designs.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan and restock her business with more cloth designs.

She hopes and dreams for a stable business that grows her profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and kente prints of different designs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is selling livestock. She has been in the business for three years. She earns a monthly income of twenty-three thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy goats to sell. She will use the profits from the expanded business to educate her children as well as increase her savings.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to be big and bring more income.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old and provides motorcycle transport in Kilifi, Kenya. He is the father of five, whose spouse provides additional income, and has been in this business for the last five years doing great.

This is his fourth borrowing to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase a second motorcycle and the anticipated profit to service his loan and educate his children. He hopes to own several motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 46 years old, married and blessed with five children.

She has been in the farming business for ten years but now wants to purchase cooking stoves for sale using the borrowed loan. She hopes this will generate income.

Rose wants to grow the business, educate her children, and provide healthcare as she longs for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking stoves

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, beans and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future she will be a millionaire.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 44 years old and married with two children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Fe has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from Avon dealership.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is a married mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and 2 of her children are in school.

Welma has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

In the future, Welma would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Febelyn is 31 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Febelyn has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in the past. She has been running her general store for 4 years and she also earns income from fish vending and frozen food retailing businesses.

Febelyn aspires to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 37 years old and married.  She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they have made enough to meet the expenses of their children.  Currently, Parveen requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to sell to her customers and generate more income.  She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to sell to her customers and generate more income.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en: Gazala is a 42-year-old married woman who has three children. She is a vigorous lady and for the past many years she has been running a cloth buy-and-sell business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale prices, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Gazala expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Upendo Wa Akina Mama Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Rael, she is a 58-year-old married woman with eleven children. She is a member of 'Upendo wa kina mama' group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2014.They were trained on enterprise and financial management skills to help run their businesses effectively.

She operates a kiosk and farms to earn a living. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy household items and seeds. She hopes for increased income to pay school fees for her children.

Rael is happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to restock the kiosk and buy seeds..

loans.name: Shamoo

texts.en: Shamoo  is a 46-year-old married woman with 2 children. In order to support her husband to take care of the family, she sells milk and is known for providing good quality milk.  She happily supports her family with the income generated. She has requested 50,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 34 years old, married and lives in Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, he is given priority in financial services to alleviate his present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which he actively participated.

Bernard has seen the changes in his general living condition from the moment he signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Burhoniddin

texts.en:
Burhoniddin was born in 1996. He is single and lives with parents in South Tajikistan. He is a student of the second course at Tajikistan National University. Burhoniddin is one of the best students and works after classes to earn money. Burhoniddin must pay for the university tuition and asks for a loan.

He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for and harvesting and earning income as well. Anita has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Anita has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds which will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Anita hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will have good results with healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is managing an Agrivet supply business in Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She gains an income of approximately PHP 35,000 every month. She wanted to expand her business by buying additional inventory of animal feed and other veterinary products to sell so she is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of animal feed and other veterinary products to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man.  He has 5 children.  He describes himself to be honest.  He operates a farm where he grows tea.  He has been involved in this business for 15 years.  His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are tea factories.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.  He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm supplies.  He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.  This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a married woman with 1 child. She operates a dairy farm and grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a dairy cow and  farm inputs. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and  farm inputs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of 7 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sweets, sugar, flour, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area.

Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, and flour, as well as other items. Her business goal is to have a big business within 5 years.

Lucy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, and flour, as well as other items.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 42 years old and all six children are enrolled in school.

Estrella has a charcoal and firewood retailing business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more firewood and charcoal to resell.

Estrella has been in this business for five years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Regielyn

texts.en:
Regielyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines.

Regielyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from charcoal sales.

In the future, Regielyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen food retailing. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her business.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Perveen to initiate her own business to sell animals. She is a 44-year-old married business woman with 5 children. Her business has provided her family with a decent living.

She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase goats and calves. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase  goats and calves.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Financial constraints, the desire for a better life, and a quality education for her 6 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged Nasreen to start her business selling animals. She is taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.  Nasreen is 54 years old and married.  She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.  She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 60000 to purchase more animals to grow her sales.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.  With this loan, she definitely will expand her business and income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to grow her sales.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel  está estudiando  la carrera de derecho para poder ascender en su trabajo y ser un buen abogado, él trabaja como técnico de computadoras para poder pagar sus estudios, se está esforzando para poder cumplir con sus metas y objetivos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Angel studies Law to be promoted and become a good lawyer. He works as a computer technician to pay his studies. He works hard in order to achieve his goals and objectives.

He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees in order to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 34 years old and has three children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life and she works as an employee in a company to help him financially.

Today, because of the fact that the new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children's educational fees. The family's only target and dream is to see them achieving their education appropriately.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 105,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar, bread and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, bread and other items.

loans.name: Karembo

texts.en:
Karembo is a married woman. She describes herself to be humble.

She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de sus estudios abrirse camino.
Tiene como meta recibirse de abogada y por medio de sus conocimientos poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios y cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Lorena is from the city of Carapeguá. She is studying to become someone in life, and get ahead.

Her goal is to graduate as a lawyer, and be able to help her beloved ones through the knowledge she acquires.

She is requesting this loan to pay the university fees, in order to be able to continue with her studies and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing retail and fish vending businesses. Mila is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Arnuldo

texts.es:
Arnulfo, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado y no siguió estudiando porque la escuela estaba muy lejos, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, junto a su esposa tienen doce hijos, de los cuales 9 viven aparte y solo tres viven con ellos. 

Arnulfo, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 49 años y ya tiene una gran experiencia en el rubro, los trabajos los aprendió de su papá cuando era muy joven y desde entonces se dedica a este trabajo. 

Arnulfo, necesita el préstamo para comprar cuatro terneros para repastarlo y venderlo, porque de este negocio es de donde el obtiene ingresos para la familia y poder continuar con la crianza de ganado por mucho más tiempo.

Arnulfo, sueña con que su hijo se dedique a las mismas actividades que él ha realizado por muchos años y no pierda la tradición familiar.
texts.en:
Arnulfo, 59 years old, went to school until seventh grade and did not continue studying because the school was too far.  He is married and his wife is a domestic worker.  Together, they have 12 children 9 of whom live on their own, while only three live with them.  Arnulfo works in agriculture and livestock.   He has done this job for 49 years, so he has accumulated great experience in that line of work.  He learned the job from his father when he was very young and he has done it since. 

Arnulfo needs the loan to buy four calves which he will feed and sell.  His family income come from that business, and also that loan will allow him to  continue raising cattle for a long time.  Arnulfo’s dream is that his son continues to work in the same activity he has performed for many years and the family tradition does not get lost.

loans.use: to buy four calves to be fed and sold

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene como meta poder ser un profesional en diseño textil, y por medio de sus estudios poder hacerse conocido en su ramo y poder ayudar a su familia.
Jorge es una persona que se destaca por su esfuerzo y por ser una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Itá. His goal is to become a professional in the area of Textiles Design. Through his studies, he wants to become known in his field and be able to help his family.

Jorge is a persistent person who stands out for his hard work and for being a devoted and hardworking person.

He is requesting this loan to cover the university expenses, and in that way be able to continue with his studies, as he has been doing so far.

loans.use: to cover the university expenses.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 50-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and six children, some of whom are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time. As for her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Darlin Marina

texts.es:
La señora Darlin Marina de 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene dos   hijos  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02 años  a la venta de abarrotería.
Doña Darlin Marina es una mujer joven trabajadora con deseo de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra  de abarrotería como arroz, azúcar, huevos, frijoles, queso, pan, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos, es su primer préstamo que solicita a Prisma  ya que viene la época de navidad y desea tener bien surtido.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Darlin Marina is 32 years old.  She lives with her husband and has two children who are dependent on her.  She lives in the area of San Lorenzo, Valle, south of Honduras.  She owns her house and has worked selling groceries for two years.  Darlin Marina is a young and hardworking woman, with strong desires to progress. 

She requests a loan to buy groceries like, rice, sugar, eggs, beans, cheese, bread, among others.  With the support of this loan she intends to improve her income.  This is the first loan she requests to Prisma, because the Christmas season is close and she wants to have sufficient stock.  Her dream is to improve her house.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras.  October, 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, beans, cheese and bread, among others for her business.

loans.name: Gornelius

texts.en:
He is 49 years old married and is blessed with six children.

He has been in carpentry business for ten years now, 

He has asked for a loan which he will use to purchase energy saving cook stoves for sales.

With the anticipated income, he will be able to repay his loan as well as restock his shop.

Her hopes and dreams in future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase energy saving cook stoves for sales

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is 46 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Imee has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Imee requested a PHP 40,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Imee has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Imee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing retail. Rowena is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery making business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery making business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial help that enabled her buy poultry feeds and met her customer's demands. She used the profit to provide for her family's basic needs such as food and education for her children.
To diversify her farming activity, she is borrowing a second Kiva loan to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. She says that this will help her get additional income to continue supporting her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer and earn more income to continue supporting her family

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge está estudiando la carrera de criminalística, su sueño es ser un buen Profesional y tener un futuro bueno y darle una mejor vida a mi familia. Él es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que pone todo de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jorge is studying Criminology. His dream is to become a good professional, have a good future, and improve his family's living conditions. He is a hardworking person who wants to become someone in life; this is why he gives the best he can.

He is requesting a loan to pay the university fees, in order to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es estudiante de la Carrera de Contaduría Publica, está cursando el último año de su carrera, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora estudia y trabaja para salir adelante y solventar los gastos de su familia.
Su sueño es terminar su carrera y el día de mañana trabajar de forma independiente para ayudar a sus familiares.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa manera poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene al finalizar su carrera.
texts.en:
Mercedes is in the last year of Public Accounting. She is a very responsible, honest, and hardworking person. She studies and works to get ahead and cover her family's expenses.

Her dream is to finish her studies and work independently in the future, to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to pay her graduation fees, now that she is about to finish her studies.

loans.use: to pay her graduation fees.

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Ana es una mujer admirable que a sus 35 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de productos helados y congelados, además cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 11 años y un varón de 3 años de edad. Ana es una mujer emprendedora que siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que ha  decidido instalar una venta de tortillas para aprovechar su clientela y la falta de un negocio así en su comunidad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: una plancha para tortillas, tambo de gas propano, maíz por mayor, etc. para su venta de tortillas. Con el crédito anterior logro construir la pila y el baño y mejorar el área del lavadero.
texts.en:
Ana is an admirable woman who, at 35 years old, works in the sale of ice cream and frozen products, and also relies on support from her partner. She lives with her partner and her two children, an 11-year-old girl and a 3-year-old boy. 

Ana is an entrepreneurial woman who always looks for ways to improve her income, so she decided to set up a tortilla business to benefit from her customer base and the lack of a similar business in her community. For this reason she is asking FUSAI for a loan to purchase: a tortilla griddle, a propane tank, wholesale corn, etc. for her tortilla business. With her previous loan she succeeded in building the washstand  and bathroom and in improving the washing area.

loans.use: to purchase: a griddle for tortillas, a propane tank, wholesale corn, etc. for her sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is 50 years old with adult-age children. Bienvenida personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She has been a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC for almost five years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 14,000.00 for the purchase of new nets.

As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marissa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Yadira Magaly

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Yadira, una madre de familia de 32 años, habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos.
A Yadira le ha tocado muy duro sacar adelante a sus pequeños, a pesar de no tener a su esposo que por problemas de la vida tuvieron que separase, ella ha hecho todo lo posible por llevar el sustento a su hogar. Desde hace años atrás cría chanchos pero en la actualidad este negocio ha bajado mucho, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de emprender en otro que le dé más ingresos y poder sostener a su familia. Yadira es clienta fiel de la institución, con el primer crédito pudo fortalecer su negocio de chanchos, compró más animales y balanceado, como el negocio estaba bajando los pudo vender en buen precio y con ese dinero ella pudo iniciar su otra actividad. Ahora se dedica al mantenimiento y servicio eléctrico el cual lleva 4 meses y le ha ido muy bien, pero aún le falta capital para seguir fortaleciéndolo. Por ello con este segundo crédito podrá capitalizarse, comprar más repuestos para seguir brindando su servicio; Yadira se siente muy feliz porque además de contar con otra fuente de ingresos ella pudo dar trabajo a un señor que es padre de familia.Yadira está muy agradecida por la ayuda prestada de KIVA ya que permite a los socios seguir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en: Yadira lives in Santo Domingo city. She is a mother of 32 years old and  lives with her two children. Yadira has had to work very hard to help her children move ahead.  In spite of not living with her husband since, for various reasons, they had to separate, she has done all she could to bring money to her home.  For years she has worked raising pigs but currently the return from this business has reduced significantly, for which reason she found herself in need of starting another business which provided her with more income and enabled her to continue sustaining her family.  Yadira is a loyal client of this institution.  With her first loan she could strengthen her pig business, and buy more animals and animal feed.  But as that business was producing less income,  she managed to sell them at a good price and with that money she could start another activity.  Now she works providing maintenance and electric services.  She has been doing this for four months and she has done well, but she needs more capital to keep growing her business.  With this second loan she will be able to capitalize the business, buy more spare parts and continue to provide her services. Yadira is very happy because besides having another source of income, she also gave job to a gentleman who is a father. Yadira is very thankful for the help given by KIVA since it allows its members to continue to grow little by little.

loans.use: To start a maintenance, and electric services workshop, and be able to make her children move forward.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis está cursando el tercer  año   de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, quiere poder culminar sus estudios y llegar a la meta de ser un Profesional y poder servir a su familia. 
El está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alexis is in third year of Commercial Engineering. He wants to finish his studies and become a useful professional that helps his family.

He is working as hard as he can to improve his and his family's living conditions.

He is requesting this loan to buy university supplies, in order to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
está cursando el primer  año de la carrera de Lic. Enfermería, es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Gladys pone su esfuerzo para poder cumplir su anhelo y ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus derechos de exámenes, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
She is in the first year of Nursing. She is a person who works hard to become someone in life and be able to help her family.

Gladys works hard in order to achieve her dream and become someone in life. She is requesting a loan to pay the examination fees, in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the examination fees.

loans.name: April Gay

texts.en: April Gay is 26 years old and a mother of two. She helps her husband earn income by selling fuel in their community. She has been doing this for more than two years. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more fuel products to sell. She is a new member of GDMPC and is thankful for the trust of lending her capital to improve her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business to earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel products to sell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Some years back, Maryam was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then, through loans from Kashf Foundation, she has started her business of hand embroidery. Maryam is 47 years old and a married woman. She has eight children. Maryam is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Maryam closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie is 43 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband and has three children now at their adult age. Merlie has been engaged in a poultry (chicken) raising business for almost three years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from this business activity. She requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs. Merlie has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Merlie hopes to expand her poultry raising business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old fish seller in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a mother of five, whose husband provides them with additional income. She has been in this business for the last four years and is doing well.

This is the first time she has borrowed to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase fresh fish for her cafe and the anticipated profit to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras que se unieron para poder ayudar a su familia.
La señora Marile, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la elaboración y posterior venta de butifarras, es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos a través de su trabajo. Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus butifarras y luego vender, como ser carne de cerdo, condimentos, y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group, called San Cayetano, is in its second cycle of the Women Committee Program. They are seventeen hardworking women who came together to help their families.

Marile contributes to her family's sustenance by making and selling botifarras. She is a hardworking woman who fights to help her family through her work.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to prepare botifarras to sell, such as pork and spices. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make botifarras, such as pork and spices.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las amigas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y por medio de su unión mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma se desempeña como tesorera  y tiene un copetín y despensa frente a su casa, y se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas y también vende productos de primera necesidad, se destaca por ser una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas variadas para la venta, e insumos para hacer comidas para la venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank named Las Amigas ("The Friends") is taking the poverty elimination survey. They came together in order to help one another, and through this union they improve their living conditions.
One of the members is Norma. She works as treasurer and owns an eatery and grocery store located in front of her house. She sells food, drinks and products that are household staples. She's known for being a very hardworking and selfless lady.
She requests this loan so that she can purchase various beverages for selling, as well as supplies to make food for selling.

loans.use: to purchase various beverages and supplies to make food for selling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has been running her convenience store for almost 30 years. She started from a small store with an initial capital of PHP 1,000 that she had in her pocket after her wedding. She invested that little amount into buying consumable goods that are commonly used in a simple household and rolled up her proceeds.

From that time on, she has expanded her little business and added more products such as liquor and cigarettes, deodorants, over the counter medicines, and even rice and corn grains for human consumption and now she also sells animal feeds. Elena recalls that her dreams of being a boss of her own business had come true.

However, she said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of Paglaum MPC that she nurtured for a longer time. She continuously provides her immediate market with their needs. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to restock store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
Fakhra is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business tailoring from her home since her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Fakhra is well-known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colours, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time.

She hopes that this will increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colours, laces, zippers, and cloth to make more dresses on time.

loans.name: 15 Corazones Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 15 Corazones está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Daniela.
Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la venta de comestibles, que ella misma hace se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Todos los días se levanta a hacer sus comidas desde muy temprano y después las vende por su barrio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "15 Corazones" is in its third cycle of the women's committee program, where all the women work and help each other get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, and one of the members is Señora Daniela.

Through her efforts, continued work, and sale of food that she makes, she earns a living in a dignified and honest way. Every day she gets up very early to make food, and later she sells it in her neighborhood. Daniela is asking for this loan in order to be able to purchase ingredients to make her food, such as greens, meats, condiments, vegetables, and others, as a way to be able to continue her sales as they come.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make her food, such as greens, meats, condiments, vegetables, and others

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde las 17 mujeres se encuentran mejorando su calidad de vida saliendo de su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dora ella vende menudencia alrededor de su barrio y zonas aledañas todos los días de la semana en un motocarro, sus productos son muy solicitados por sus clientes ya que los higieniza totalmente. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Dora solicita este préstamo para abastecerse con más menudencias y así obtener mayor ingreso para el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida y el de toda su familia.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is doing a poverty elimination investigation in which 17 women are improving their quality of life and getting out of poverty.

One of the members is Dora. She sells odds and ends around her neighborhood and in surrounding areas on a motorbike. Her products are in demand among her customers since she completely sanitizes them. She is a hard working, self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead.

Dora is applying for this loan in order to supply her business with more odds and ends to thus have better income to improve her quality of life and that of her whole family.

loans.use: to purchase odds and ends to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 8° del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
María es una de las que integra este grupo, se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de confecciones, y gracias a su buen trabajo se ha hecho ya de mucha clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos. María por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes y también mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank named Las Emprendedoras ("The Entrepreneurs") is in its 8th loan cycle with the Women's Committee program. They are taking a poverty elimination survey. They're striving and making an effort to improve their and their loved ones' living conditions.
María is one of the members of the group. She's a seamstress and makes all types of garments. Thanks to her good work she has gained a lot of customers that always place many orders. Through her work, María obtains the means to improve her living conditions.
She requests this loan so that she can purchase fabric, thread, adhesive, etc. That way she'll be able to continue meeting her customers' orders and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and adhesive for dressmaking.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 31-year-old second-hand clothes dealer from Mombasa, Kenya.

Leah is a mother of four, who has been in this business for the last four years doing well with the support of her spouse.

This is Leah's first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business; she will use the money to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

Leah hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Bebina's Group

texts.en:
Bebina, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, hails from Odagaon in Odisha, India. She is a divorcee and has an 8-year-old daughter in her care. Bebina, being a strong and capable lady, has never broken down after her husband left her alone with her small daughter. She stood rock strong in order to fight all the odds that came in front of her.

She is engaged in a candle-making business. Keeping in view the erratic power supply condition in her area and to provide the community with convenience, she started making candles three years ago.

Bebina, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR .She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to repair her candle-making machine, which is not working smoothly anymore due to years of wear and tear and to purchase raw wax and threads for her business so that she can serve her community by her voluminous output and meeting the demand with her supply.

Bebina is eagerly awaiting for your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to repair her candle-making machine, which is not working smoothly anymore due to years of wear and tear and to purchase raw wax and threads

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 41-year-old, married lady and she has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.

Anwar makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available to her customers. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demands consistently.

Anwar wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality of life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available to her customers.

loans.name: Ranjita's Group

texts.en:
Ranjita, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a differently abled lady from a village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is a blessed mother of four daughters and her husband works as a school bus driver in their village.

For the last five years, she has been engaged in weaving clothes. She has inherited this from her ancestors as this was her family business. She earns a pretty good amount of money from this business and has a very large customer base. Ranjita is a very ambitious lady who has never looked back. Her high aspirations and dreams have always helped her in moving forward in life, overcoming all the hurdles.

She, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Ranjita will use her portion of the loan amount to repair her weaving machine, which is not working properly, and is causing delay in processing her orders and the other part of the loan amount will be used to purchase raw materials for her weaving business like colourful threads, ribbons, needles etc.

Ranjita dreams of opening a boutique someday and attracting the attention of premium segments of customers.

loans.use: to repair her weaving machine and to purchase raw materials for her weaving business like colourful threads, ribbons, and needles

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres se llama RENACER conformado por mujeres esforzadas y muy emprendedoras siguen con la meta de contrarrestar la pobreza de sus hogares, y saben el compromiso que han tomado con la Fundación y con ellas mismas.
La Señora Mabel es peluquera, comenta que tiene un modesto salón que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar y que gracias a el y a su trabajo esta pudiendo mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Mabel es una persona que desde joven se ha sacrificado y aún sigue haciéndolo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tijeras y otros, de manera a poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The women's group called RENACER is formed by hardworking and enterprising women. They continue with the goal to counteract poverty in their homes, and they understand the promise they have made to the Foundation and to themselves.

Mabel is a hairdresser. She comments that she has a modest salon that she was able to start with a lot of sacrifice, and that thanks to it and her work she is able to improve their living conditions. Mabel is a person who has sacrificed since she was young, and still she continues doing it to be able to help her family.

She asks for this loan to invest in buying dyes, shampoo, mouthwash, creams, scissors, and other items, and in that way be able to continue offering good service to her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and improve in her undertaking.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, mouthwash, creams, scissors, and other items.

loans.name: Jamuna's Group

texts.en:
Jamuna, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a divorcee who hails from a village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her four-year-old daughter in her parental house. Life was not easy for Jamuna after her husband ditched her. She had to struggle very hard in order to earn her own bread and reduce her dependence on her old parents but she succeeded.

Jamuna is engaged in an incense stick making business. She makes incense sticks and sells them to the nearest wholesaler and earns her livelihood from it. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to purchase raw materials like scented powder, wooden sticks, glue etc. in bulk so as to produce a voluminous amount of incense sticks and fetch a good price.

Jamuna aspires to provide the best education to her only daughter and see her become successful in her life.She is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like scented powder, wooden sticks, and glue in bulk.

loans.name: Rebati's Group

texts.en:
At 33 years of age, Rebati, a divorcee standing to the right-hand side in the photograph, has gone through various circumstances and difficulties in her life. Just to mention one of them, she doesn’t have a formal job. But her courage, perseverance, and desire to succeed make her get up every day to work on her poultry business.

Over the last four years, this young entrepreneur has acquired the skills of animal husbandry and developed a loyal clientele. But as with most small-scale businesses, gathering the financial resources to expand her venture remains a major challenge for the 33-year-old.

She, along with her fellow group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in more than eight dozen chickens and also provide for their fodder, transportation and necessary medication.

Rebati hopes that this loan will increase her profits and will ultimately take her business to the next level. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to invest in more than eight dozen chickens and also provide for their fodder, transportation and necessary medication.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Greetings from Mrgashat village of Armavir region. Marine is married with five children, aged 4 through 14; four of them attend school.

The family's only income source is from agriculture on the farm they run. It includes raising pigs and the cultivation of vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, grapes, and watermelon. Using his own truck, Marine's husband sells the gathered harvest in a nearby community market to earn his family's living.

Marine's requested loan will help this family to purchase two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock, in addition to covering the cultivation costs to expand and develop their agribusiness.

Marine says that the extra income from this loan will help her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, and to cover the cultivation costs to expand her agribusiness and earn more income for their family.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a maize farmer from Kareh Ganuwa village. As a Babban Gona member, Naomi is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Naomi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Naomi can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Naomi no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Naomi hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Sobia is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Salama has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salama would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salama can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Salama will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Salama is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mbyja Koe Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mbyja Koe integrado  por  15 mujeres , se encuentran en el 5° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, son muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Dominga quién solamente se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de queso, y comenta que ella ha iniciado un negocio propio que consiste en la compra y venta de ropas para damas y caballeros.  Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante para ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
La Señora Dominga pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio y por ende contribuirá a su bienestar económico.
texts.en:
The "Mbyja Koe" communal bank is made up of fifteen women. They are in their 5th lending cycle with the "comité de mujeres" program. The women are all very hard-working and self-sacrificing. They help one another so that they may grow.

One of the communal bank members is señora Dominga. She used to make and sell cheese as her only source of income. She says that she has started another business buying and selling women's and men's clothing. Señora Dominga is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead so she can help her family and her loved ones.

Señora Dominga is requesting this loan so she can purchase clothing, which will help her to solidify her business plan. This will contribute to her financial well-being.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Naik

texts.en:
Naik is 47 years old, married and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business, Currently, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Naik aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns at present.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Pramila's Group

texts.en:
Pramila, standing on the right hand side in the photograph, is a differently abled lady and hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India.
