Pramila's optimistic nature and strong willpower has never broken down. She has faced every hurdle very sportively and has overcome them. She is an inspiration for her two daughters.

Pramila is engaged in embroidery work. She is a skilled embroiderer and has inherited this quality from her ancestors. The uniqueness of her embroideries attracts and lures customers to purchase the fabrics.

Pramila, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials like colored stones, glitter, ribbons and smooth linen fabric in bulk for her business. The loan amount will ultimately help Pramila to increase her standard of living and enjoy a happy and peaceful life with her family.

Pramila is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like colored stones, glitter, ribbons and smooth linen fabric in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is a married woman. She has been working at hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Virgen del Pilar, son de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La Sra. María es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Comerciante, tiene un negocio propio, próspero de la zona, ella vive con sus  hijos todos en la casa colaboran en el bienestar de la familia vive en casa propia, es casada. Tiene una despensa bien surtida que con mucho sacrificio ha podido crecer y mejorar.
 La Sra. María solicita  este préstamo  para aumentar la variedad de productos en su negocio de manera a atraer a más clientes, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, panificados, lácteos y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called "Virgen del Pilar" is from the city of San Ignacio. They are united and supportive of each other, working together on activities. They demonstrate their acceptance and feeling of support from the Woman's Committees Program so that they can increase their income and be ever more independent.

María is the president of the group. She is a businesswoman who has her own business, successful in her area. She lives in her own house with her children. She is married and everyone in the house collaborates with the well-being of the family. She has a well stocked store that with great satisfaction she has managed to grow and improve.

María is requesting this loan to increase the variety of products in her business in order to attract more clients, like vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, dairy products and others.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, bakery products, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” .
La socia continua  vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como jaboncillos, pasadores, cremas, cuerdas, lana y otras cosas más, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su negocio pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de jaboncillos, lanas entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the community bank "Patrón de San Sebastián".
She continues to sell different types of products, such as soap, hair clips, creams, thread and yarn, as well as other item. She is a responsible woman and through her business she hopes to be able to earn more revenue to be able to continue supporting her family.
She is grateful for the loan and promises to make all her payments.
She is requesting the loan to buy soap and wool, among other things.

loans.use: to buy soap and wool, among other things.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, 51, is a hardworking woman who has three children. For years she has been a tailor in her community. Her work pulled the family out of a financial crisis that it was facing when she started working. She is quite popular due to her sewing skills and has established a good clientele.

Irshad has applied for a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy a new sewing machine, lace and spools of thread to enable her to fulfill her customers orders consistently. She aspires to save money to build a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, lace and spools of thread

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 40-year-old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Safia makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Safia wishes to use part of her revenues to provide good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, 45, is married and the mother of eight children. Daily increasing expenditures compelled to start her own business selling animals. With the help of her husband she has worked hard for many years to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Her work has managed to give them a decent life.

Nasreen has applied for a 45,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf in order to buy more baby goats and calves to increase her sales. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling blankets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy bundles of blankets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of blankets and bedspreads in different colors and designs to increase her sales.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Habila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Habila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 30 years old. She is a married woman who runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews and then sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

The garment selling business has allowed her to help earn money for the household, thus easing the expenses and improving the standard of living for the family.

For the improvement of her business, Kosar has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving her standard of living.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es: Erasmo es un hombre trabajador de 59 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y además se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Erasmo is a hard-working 59 year old man. He lives with his partner in the rural community of Lari, which is located in Arequipa. He works as agricultural labor and also works raising organic cattle placing much attention to the care and food he provides them, which consists of organic alfalfa that he grows.

He is requesting a micro-loan to be able to buy an organic cow hoping to sell it's milk at a higher price being organic. In the future he hopes to be able to provide his family with a better quality of living, continue to enjoy good health, a reason he is betting on organic.

loans.use: to buy an organic cow to sell the milk it produces and in doing so improve his income.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
As it is for many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Salma to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Salma is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Zargunakhon

texts.en:
Zargunakhon was born in 1989. She is a smart and young woman. Zargunakhon is single, and she lives with her parents in the capital of Tajikistan.

Zargunakhon is a sewer. She sews different kinds of women's clothes. Zargunakhon sews dresses, suits, skirts, trousers, etc. She has a rich imagination and she sews fashionable clothes.

Zargunakhon has a workshop, and she little by little with the passing of the time has developed her business. She has worked in this field for more than three years.

Now, Zargunakhon is going to buy a new sewing machine because her sewing machine is broken. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ishkhan

texts.en:
Ishkhan lives with his nice and big family in Yeghegnut village of Armavir region. The family consists of seven members and agriculture is the only course of income for them.

Ishkhan started running a farm 20 years ago, and due to hard work in those years, the current farm is successful and profitable enough to sustain his family. He specializes in livestock breeding, keeping 25 cows, 18 hens, and 60 oxen.

To sustain the family's income and develop his farm, Ishkhan requested this loan. He asks lenders to help him to purchase forage (barley, grass, and mixed) to feed the livestock during the winter season and sustain the farm.

The loan will greatly support him in preparing the farm for the coming winter season and he hopes for support.

loans.use: to pay for forage (barley, grass, and mixed) to feed the livestock during the winter season and sustain the farm.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, 49, has two children and is married to the gentleman in the photo. She works grinding flour for members of her community to contribute to the family’s income. She has much experience in her work and knows well grinding techniques. Over the years she has become well known for providing fine-quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family.

Nasreen has applied for a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation to buy a new grinding machine. It would help her to fulfill her customers’ orders in a timely fashion and so generate more income. She wishes to spend her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 32-year-old married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has three children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor in her street. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town.

She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed, so she is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation.

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams, to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn a good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Shaheen is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000.

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Twitezimbere-Busogo Group

texts.en:
Marie is a married 44-year-old woman with four children who are between 15 and 23 years old. She is the leader of Twitezmbere-Busgogo Group and is pictured holding a paper in her hands. She works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life.

For the past one year, Marie has sold pigs at the market. Every morning Marie opens her shop at 8 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. Sometimes she is required to venture outside the market to sell her pigs door to door.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business by purchasing many pigs for sale. With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family and to pay school fees for her children. She will use the remaining profit to expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase many pigs for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria viene  de una familia muy trabajadora, ella está trabajando y estudiando  la carrera de Administración de empresas, comenta que desea poder aplicar todo lo que aprendió a su profesión y ayudar a las personas que lo necesiten.
Una vez que culmine su carrera quiere seguir estudiando para mejorar. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Maria comes from a very hard-working family. She is working and studying business administration. She states that she wishes to be able to apply everything that she has learned to her career so that she can help those who need this knowledge. Once she finishes her degree, she wants to continue studying in order to improve.

Maria is requesting this loan to pay her university tuition.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a widow living with her only son in Mrgavan village of Ararat region. Her farm is 12 years old, and over those years, Zhanna has been able to produce and sell only high quality fruits and vegetables in local markets.

She applied for this loan to purchase two calves, fertilizer, and grape seeds for developing the farm.

Because the family needs a permanent source of income, Zhanna works hard to sustain the farm during the winter. She hopes to receive lenders' support and faith.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, fertilizer, grape seeds for developing the farm

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mathew has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mathew will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mathew is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Isiya

texts.en:
Alhaji Isiya is a maize farmer from Sabon Gari Daji village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Isiya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Isiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhaji Isiya can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Isiya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Isiya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and use to do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a married parent of four children. She is 58 years old.

Zaynab, ten years ago, began her own business because she needed to make money. During those ten years, she has been busy with buying and selling candies and biscuits in a local market. She has a selling place in a local market.

She periodically renews the assortment of her goods because the business struggle in a local market is big. Zaynab is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy candies, chocolates, and biscuits for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy candies, chocolates, and biscuits for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en:
Rabo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Rabo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Duteraninkunga-Byahi Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 31 years old and married with three children. In the photo, she is the only one who is sitting in front of others. She owns a general business. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily.

Esperance is a leader of this group, which is called Duteraninkunga-Byahi in the local language; the name means "helping each other" in English.

Esperance has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc., for sale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children, reinvest in her business, and to be able to expand her general store by buying various and more new stores.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Rayan Group

texts.en:
Abir is the featured borrower of Rayan group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they all work hard on developing their businesses and living at the same time.

Abir is a 41-year-old single lady, who works as a beauty specialist with fourteen years of experience. In 2010, she started her own business, and is working hard to develop it as much as she can.

Her income is good enough to cover her living needs, but not for unexpected urgent issues. That's why her acquired loan will be invested in paying for necessary dental medical expenses she has to undergo. She will also use part of the loan to buy the newly-released winter beauty cosmetics collection.

Abir is the second lady from the right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Nawal is the second from the left, Sanaa is the lady at the far left side of the picture, while Jessy is the blond lady at the right.

loans.use: To pay for necessary dental medical expenses she has to undergo

loans.name: Nour Al Zahraa Group

texts.en:
Souhad is the featured borrower of Nour Al Zahraa group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they all seek to develop their living and business at the same time.

Souhad is the lady at the center of the picture. She is a 38-year-old married mother of three, who has been working as a taxi driver on her own for one year. She has nine years of experience in this domain since she was employed as a driver in a sawmill.

Souhad's income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover their family's increasing living needs. Thus, for this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her medical dental expenses and renew her driving license to continue working as a taxi driver and providing transportation services.

As for the other group members, Nada is the lady on the right side of the picture, while Amira is the lady on the far left side.

loans.use: to pay for her medical dental expenses and renew her driving license to continue working as a taxi driver and providing transportation services.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sarah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land – 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, to meet her immediate needs for food and clothing, Sarah had to sell her maize at harvest, when maize prices are lowest. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sarah can store her maize and sell later for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sarah will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sarah is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a single man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells movies. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more movies to meet customer demands. His business goal is to open other outlets within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more movies to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has two children. She describes herself to be humble. 

Fatuma operates a food café, and has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate space. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. 

This is Fatuma's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to buy modern catering equipment.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Eduardo German

texts.es: Eduardo es un joven trabajador de 21 años que vive junto a sus padres en la localidad rural de Talamolle Viejo, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero de construcción y además se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva en el terreno agrícola de sus padres. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro desea poder contar con mayor cantidad de ganado y le gustaría tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a hard-working young man who is 21 years old. He lives with his parents in the rural town of Talamolle Viejo, which is located in Moquegua. He makes a living as a construction worker. In addition, he raises organic cattle. He always pays very close attention to their care and to the feed that he gives them, which is composed of organic alfalfa that he grows on his parents' land.

He is requesting a loan to buy two organic cows. He hopes to be able to sell their milk at a better price since it is organic. In the future, he desires to have more cattle, and he wishes to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy two organic cows in order to sell the milk that they produce and, that way, increase his income.

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en:
Surrounded with poor financial circumstances, Shumila needed to start her own business to increase her purchasing power for meeting her household expenditures financially. 

Shumila is a 27-year-old, married mother of two children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman and is blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has benefited from the training, especially enterprise and financial management.

She is a vegetable farmer and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that with better seeds and fertilizers she will be able to get more produce that will be enough for her family’s consumption and for sale, and enable her to support her children’s education.

Zipporah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and certified seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 25-year-old married mother of two children. She is working hard to fulfil their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   

Together with her husband, she has been doing agricultural work for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruit, and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Samina  has applied a loan of 35,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Kurbonaly

texts.en:
Kurbonaly was born in 1976. He is kind and smart man. Kurbonaly is married and has five children. 

He has worked for more than five years as a master of repairing houses. Little by little, with the passing of the time, he has developed his knowledge and abilities. Kurbonaly is the only earner in family as his wife is a housewife. He is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy medicine for the treatment of his child. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of his son.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 23-year-old married mother of one. She has been working as a hairdresser from her house since 2008, where she has gained eight years of experience. Samar took the training to acquire the talents and skills necessary in her domain through her friend, who works in the same domain. She is working hard to develop her business as much as she can, although it is still located at home.

She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a newly released winter beauty cosmetic collection and hair treatment needs.

Her income and her husband's limited monthly salary are expected to cover their family's necessary living needs.
She hopes that in the future she can move her business outside her house, and attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a newly released winter beauty cosmetic collection and hair treatment needs

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with three children. She operates a pub where she sells drinks, and has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Emmylou

texts.en:
Emmylou, a 41-year-old mother of six, resides in Mauswagon, Calamba, Misamis Occidental with her family. She has been helping her husband work on their own farm to make a living. 

Emmylou joined GDMPC in 2012 and has recently taken a loan to buy additional organic fertilizer to improve her banana farm. It was her dream to provide a better education to her children. With this, they work harder in their farm for it is their only main source of income. In the future, she wants to have a comfortable and a better living with the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer to improve her banana farm

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs an oyster-farm in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sonia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 36-year-old married woman.

She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from city markets and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Salma has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Farmeeda

texts.en:
It was hard for Farmeeda to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. 

Farmeeda is a 40-year-old married mother of seven children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Farmeeda has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria está cursando el 2do año de Administración de Empresas, tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres es soltera aun,  desea terminar sus estudios, para poder conseguir un trabajo en el ramo para ayudar a sus familiares.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza mucho para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gloria is in her second year of a program in Business Administration. She is 21 and single, and she lives with her parents. She wants to complete her studies and get a job in that area in order to help her family.

She is a person who works hard for a better quality of life for herself and her loved ones. She is asking for this loan in order to pay her tuition and be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
To make a living, Evangeline helps her husband manage their banana farm. She earns well from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She always finds ways to obtain a better source of income.

Evangeline took a new loan recently from GDMPC to purchase additional organic fertilizer and seedlings to expand her farm. She hopes that with this loan, it will make their farm more productive and that their farm produce will get a better result at the market.

She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer and seedlings to expand her farm.

loans.name: Joelyn

texts.en:
Joelyn is 42 years old and married with one child in school. Joelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Joelyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future Joelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 55-year-old, hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her area. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Kaneez ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Kaneez has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Xasay

texts.en:
Xasay lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. His wife is a teacher and his daughter is in the fifth class at school. 

Xasay had insufficient income from his agricultural business, and that is the reason why he decided to change his business. Xasay has been running a cafe now. He offers his customers national Azerbaijan dishes made from mutton and organic vegetables. Those dishes are delicious and of good quality. Today he needs his second loan in the amount of 1,950 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He wants to buy tables and chairs for his cafe. “Thanks, dear Kiva lenders, for your help and support."

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his café.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su profesión, es por ello que pone todo de si, comenta que con su préstamo anterior pudo pagar sus gastos de transporte. Es una persona que se sacrifica mucho por poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo nuevo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Maria is very dedicated to her studies. She wants to be able to help others through her profession, so she gives her best effort. She says that her previous loan allowed her to pay for her transportation expenses. She is a person who makes a lot of sacrifices in order to grow.

She is requesting this new loan to pay her tuition.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Roly

texts.es:
Roly es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la licenciatura en Gestión de Calidad, comenta que por medio de ella quiere poder abrirse camino y convertirse en un buen profesional.
Su meta es ser un profesional eficaz y eficiente, útil a la sociedad, tener su propia empresa y ser su propio jefe. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Roly is from the city of San Ignacio, and is studying for a degree in Quality Management. He says that in this way he wants to open doors and become a good professional.

His goal is to be an effective and efficient professional, useful to society, to have his own business, and to be his own boss.

He requests this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for his degree.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.en:
Rayhona was born in 1997. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. Rayhona is single. 

Since childhood she has liked reading, and she often goes to the library for reading. Rayhona is a student in the first course Medical College, learning pharmacy. After graduating college she will work in any pharmacy, but she dreams to open her own pharmacy. Rayhona’s parents do not have the ability to pay for her university tuition fees, and so she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Najida

texts.en:
Najida  is 44 years old, married, and a mother of 6 children. She works hard to fulfil their demands including food, health, clothing, and education.   She, along with her husband, has been doing agricultural work for some years. They grow crops of different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Najida has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Matta is a maize farmer from Dantani village. As a Babban Gona member, Matta is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Matta would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Matta can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Matta no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Matta hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Absalom

texts.en:
Absalom is a 27-year-old computer technician from Mwamlai Mombasa, Kenya. 

He is a father of one and the spouse provides for his additional income. He has run this business for the last two years and it has been succesful.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase computer spare parts and the anticipated profit to expand his workshop. 

He hopes to employ more youths for training in his shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase computer spare parts.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 28-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial conditions, so she started a business selling bed-sheets. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Rabia  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase new collections of bed-sheets, spreads and bed covers to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase new collections of bed-sheets, spreads and bed covers to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Kaigoro Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Jenifa, a mother of four children, is a member of Kaigoro Kweterana group, and is a hardworking married woman living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She wants a loan to buy more produce such as maize to sell. She has a produce business where she sells a variety of products like beans and rice, among others depending on seasons. To supplement her income, she does farming, where she has reaped more income to sustain her family. She is challenged by seasonality changes, along with price fluctuations of agricultural produce. Jenifa’s dream is to become a leading produce dealer in her area, and having a fully stocked produce store. 

Her group has lasted for a long time due to the good credit history with trustworthy members, and is one of the oldest groups of Hofokam LTD-Uganda.

loans.use: buy more produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Kuña guapa está en su ciclo número 17º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder crecer y mejorar.
Laura, una de las integrantes, se dedica a vender lencerías de todo tipo, comenta que con sus ventas tiene los medios para poder crecer y salir adelante. Laura es una  mujer muy luchadora y pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencerías variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its 17th cycle of the Women's Committee Program, where the women all work together and help one another. They are also in the poverty elimination program in order to grow and improve.

Laura, one of the group members, works selling all sorts of lingerie. She says that with her sales she has the means to grow and succeed. Laura is a very determined woman. She requests this loan in order to buy a variety of lingerie in order to continue her sales. She is grateful for this opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is 59 years old and a mother of six children, and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working as wood carpenter for one year; her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold. 

Taj's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for making furniture, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy these merchandises. Therefore Taj has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business purposes and earn profitable income to meet the daily needs of his family and business.

Taj is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: enable her husband to buy items for this furniture business.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Lawal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is farmer with 15 years of experience. She is 55 years old, and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.
 
Rita's husband works as a migrant laborer in a neighbouring country, and her son works in a local school as a teacher. Rita has been running her mixed farm for many years. She sells a wide variety of products at the local market. The primary income comes from the sale of milk, cereals, chickens and eggs, while she also buys and sells cattle on occasion. 

Rita has requested this loan to purchase potato seeds and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her cover the family's basic costs and will allow her provide proper nutrition for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a 47-year-old mother of one child, and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of he entire family. Sajida has also been running her boutique business for the past four years, and contributes her income with that of her husband to manage the household.

Sajida needs to buy different types of dresses for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

With this financial assistance, Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her boutique business by buying different types of dresses to re-sell.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini will store the maize he harvests, and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hussaini now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 24 years old and is from Mtskheta district. He lives with his wife and pensioner grandmother. 

Archil works at a local shop as a butcher and gets a small monthly income. Archil wants to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for purchasing all the necessary machinery and equipment for opening a car wash service. After the business is started, the family will have a stable source of additional income and the family members will make savings for further well-being. Archil and his wife rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be very thankful for the support.

loans.use: to open a car wash business.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusif has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yusif can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Yusif will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yusif is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña pora  está trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes, quien vende prendas de todo tipo, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella todo lo que vende. Ella siempre pone todo de si para poder capacitarse y crecer en su emprendimiento.
Pide este prestamo para poder comprar prendas de todo tipo, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene hacienda.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Pora is working within the poverty elimination program. Each member puts in their greatest effort in order to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Mercedes, who sells garments of all types. She states that she has a very good clientele who always buys everything she sells. She always gives it her all in order to train herself and grow her business.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy garments of all types such as jeans, shirts, pants, and others, so that she can continue with her sales the way she is now.

loans.use: to buy garments of all types to sell such as jeans, shirts, pants, and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Triunfantes están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Anne, quien se dedica en la venta de helados, también se debe destacar el trabajo y el esfuerzo que ella hace por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Anne se unió al grupo para poder crecer y mejorar su humilde emprendimiento y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de helados variados, de manera a tener un buen stock que ofrecer a sus clientes y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Mujeres Triunfantes (Triumphant Women) group examines poverty elimination. 4 of the members are below the poverty line. They are in extreme poverty and striving to improve every day.

One of the members is Anne who sells ice cream. Aside from work she also works hard to improve the living conditions for her and her family. Anne joined the group to grow and improve her humble venture and continue to help her family.

She requests a loan to buy various ice cream. This will allow her to have a good stock for her customers. She appreciates the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy various ice cream for sales.

loans.name: Karo

texts.en:
Karo is 60 years old and lives with his wife and son in Kapan city of Syunik region. Karo works as a driver. His son also works as a driver at the city’s hospital. His daughter is already married and she lives in Yerevan city. 

A year ago, Karo’s wife had surgery because of her health problems. Now, it is time for her to pass a medical exam which means additional expenses for the family which has very little income for their living. Karo is asking for this loan of 200,000 AMD to pay for his wife's medical exam at the hospital.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical exam at the hospital.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married father of five, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. 

Due to the low financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, he left school at an early age and started working in auto repairs to cover his needs and expenses. He has 32 years of experience in this field and he is well-known in his region.

Mahmoud is trying hard to develop his business, and therefore today he is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an unusable car to maintain it and then sell it at a good price. This loan will help him increase his production. 

In the future, Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more, and to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy an unusable car to maintain it and then sell it for a good price.

loans.name: Araqsya

texts.en:
Araqsya is a farmer from Gay village in the Armavir region. She specializes in crop cultivation, currently growing peppers, tomatoes, and greens in the greenhouse and in the farm yard. 
Araqsya states that economic hardships and lack of technical equipment on the farm are big challenges for her farming business, but she works hard to sustain it and gather income for the family. 
The loan will help Araqsya to purchase a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse, and seeds for cultivation to have a rich harvest to sell. She hopes for lenders' support and dreams of seeing her farm grow in near future.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse, and seeds for cultivation to have a rich harvest to sell

loans.name: Koe Pyta Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama KOE PYTA, es un grupo muy unido y antiguo con 18 integrantes, se encuentra en el 7mo ciclo, son mujeres muy unidas que quieren mejorar sus vidas a través de la ayuda de su grupo y la fundación paraguaya.
Se destaca a la Sra. Vicenta quien por su personalidad activa y espíritu emprendedor cada día va mejorando la huerta que tiene. En un principio solo una pequeña huerta, pero hoy día ya cuenta una plantación de mandioca y sandia. Es quien guía a sus compañeras de este grupo para seguir con el mismo desempeño y lograr muchos beneficios a través del trabajo unido, cooperativo y solidario.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar abonos y semillas de todo tipo para poder seguir con las plantaciones en su huerta, y agradece por la oportunidad que reciben todas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee is called Koe Pyta. It is a very united and longstanding group with 18 members. It is currently in its 7th cycle. These are women who are very united and who want to improve their lives through the help of their group and Fundación Paraguaya.

The featured member is Vicenta who, through her active personality and entrepreneurial spirit, is improving the garden she has each day. It was only a small garden at first, but today she has a cultivation of yuca and watermelon. She is the one who guides her colleagues to continue with the same performance and achieve many benefits through work that is united, cooperative, and supportive.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy fertilizer and seeds of all types to be able to continue with the plantings in her garden. She is grateful for the opportunity they all receive to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and various seeds to grow in the garden.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Valientes es un grupo antiguo, bastante unido, están en el sexto ciclo con 16 integrantes, todas con espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación. Ellas sostienen que salir adelante es un desafío motivador, el poder  progresar a través del esfuerzo propio, con la solidaridad y apoyo de las compañeras del comité.
Todas son mujeres rurales, que trabajan la tierra y crían animales ya que sus condiciones así lo permiten, entre ellas se destaca a la Sra. Maria que cultiva en la huerta que tiene y comercializa su producción en diferentes barrios aledaños a su domicilio.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de abonos y semillas variadas para plantar en huerta.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women). It's an long-standing group whose members are quite connected to one another. They are in their sixth lending cycle with sixteen members. All of them have enterprising spirits and desires to improve their situations. They maintain that getting ahead is a motivating challenge. They have the power to move forward through their own hard work in solidarity with, and with the support of, their friends in the communal bank.

They are all rural women who work the land and raise animals. Their life conditions allow for that type of work. Sra. Maria stands out among the women of the communal bank. She plants in the vegetable garden she has and sells her produce in the various neighborhoods adjacent to where she lives.

Sra. Maria is asking for this loan to purchase compost and a variety of seeds so she can plant her garden.

loans.use: to purchase compost and seeds to plant her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en: Nvard is 61 years old and she lives in Vedi village in the Ararat region. Nvard has vocational education and the specialty of accountant. Nvard is not married and she lives alone. For many years she has worked as an accountant at a private company. Nvard also does farming.  She specializes in turkey breeding and she has many turkeys. She mentions that turkey breeding is very profitable for her and she sells at the city’s wholesale market. The price is the highest near the Christmas and New Year holidays. Nvard, like many farmers, is very worried about providing her turkeys with enough fodder. She requests this loan to purchase enough fodder for her turkeys for the winter period.

loans.use: to purchase enough fodder for her turkeys for the winter period.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 48-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 7 children.  She and her husband are responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Nusrat has also been doing business selling clothing for the past 10 years and contributes her income, with her husband, to manage the household.
Nusrat needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business.  Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan she can purchase the clothes easily for her business needs so that she can earn more profit to support her family and business.
For this financial assistance Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Habila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Habila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El comité San Jose, es un grupo que trabaja de manera unida para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder capacitarse y crecer.
La Sra. Nilsa es una de las integrantes de este grupo y se la destaca por su actitud activa e innovadora, ella trabaja la tierra y cría animales y luego las comercializa desde su propia casa, vende mandioca, hortalizas, carne de cerdo, gallinas, huevo, queso, etc. y de esta manera ella ayuda a su marido a sustentar el hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
La Sra. Nilsa pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, y abonos para poder plantar y animales para la cría, de manera a poder seguir con su humilde trabajo.
texts.en:
The San Jose committee is a group that works unitedly to improve their living conditions and the living conditions of their families, each of them gives their best effort to train themselves and grow. 

Mrs. Nilsa is one of the members of the group and she stands out for her active and innovative attitude, she works the land and breeds animals and then sells them from her own house, she sells cassava, vegetables, pork, chickens, eggs, cheese, etc. and in this way she helps her husband support the household and raise their children.  

Mrs. Nilsa is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers so she can farm, and animals to breed, so she can be able to continue her humble work.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming and animals to breed

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 5 children. Her husband is responsible for the needs of the family. Rasheeda provides sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 
She needs different kinds of accessories like needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and etc for her business. But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Rasheeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy accessories to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en:
Jibrin is maize farmer from Karofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Jibrin is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Jibrin would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Jibrin can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Jibrin is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 45-year-old woman and mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession and sells apples, bananas, grapes, and more. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.
Saeeda's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not able to purchase fruit for his business.
Therefore Saeeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit so her husband can increase his fruit business

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integra este grupo llamado San Isidro está en su ciclo número 8° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Lisa,  quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y pone todo de si para poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are 18 women who make up this group, called San Isidrio. They are in their 8th cycle of the program of the women's committee, where they work and help each other to move forward through the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Lisa, who through her effort and continuous work and by selling clothes that she makes, has the means to help her family. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who through effort is moving forward and gives everything to be able to grow. 

She is asking for this loan to buy shirts, pants and other items to be able to offer good variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy items to sell, such as: shirts, pants and other items

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives and works in Aknaghbyur village in theTavush region as a farmer. Her husband, using his own tractor, provides rental harvesting service to local people in the village, so Anahit takes care of their family farm alone.Their daughter studies at the university. 
Farming is a very important source of income for Anahit's family, so she would really like to develop it. She requests this loan to purchase a sow, piglets, and wheat seeds and to cover renovation costs for the barn. 
Anahit hopes to obtain a larger profit for family's income and see her farm grow in near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sow, piglets, and wheat seeds and to cover renovation costs for the barn

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives in Gurjaani, Kakheti region, East Georgia with her big family. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a vineyard and work hard physically. Nana decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 6000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a minibus and a stock of fruits and vegetables. Her husband will be a driver and they both will start selling fruits and vegetables in order to generate stable income. Nana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to sell fruits and vegetables with her husband and generate a stable income

loans.name: Santacruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santacruz está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, una zona alejada y de difícil acceso, donde las integrantes no acceden a muchos servicios.
La Sra. Lina es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio dedicado a la Costura, es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, y así seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Santacruz group is in its third cycle of the women's committee program, it's located in the city of Curuguaty, a remote and hard to access area, where the members don't have access to many services.  

Mrs. Lina is one of the members, she has a small sewing business, she's good at what she does, and for this reason she has very good clientele who always return and place many orders.  

She is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, rubber, and other items, so she can continue making clothing as she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, rubber, and other items

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is a 24-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and two children. Her husband is responsible for meeting the needs of the family, while Hina also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute to managing the household.
Hina needs various supplies for her business, such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth and machine oil, but cannot buy them due to insufficient capital. Thus, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will allow her to buy these supplies and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by enabling her to provide better sewing services.
Hina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 47-year-old mother of four living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of the family and supports the entire household, having run his own business as a juice wholesaler for the past eight years.
Rukhsana's husband needs to buy juice bags in bulk and other commodities for the business, but due to financial constraints he is unable to afford these. Thus, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities and maximize his profits. It will thus also help him to make savings to meet the needs of the family and business.
Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband improve his wholesale juice business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 34-year-old married mother of four and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Six years ago, she started selling perfumes, cosmetics and make-up to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.
Lina is working hard to develop her business; thus today she is taking out a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of perfumes and makeup, in addition to some winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.
Lina hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of perfumes, make up and some winter clothes.

loans.name: Alh. Murtala

texts.en:
Alhaji Murtala is a maize farmer from Arewa village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Murtala is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhaji Murtala can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Murtala no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alhaji Murtala hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 29-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 12 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Uzma's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories; e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose. Therefore Uzma has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Uzma is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring accessories to help her husband increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
A 36-year-old divorced mother of one child, who has been working for two years as an employee in a perfumes and cosmetics selling shop to cover her beloved son's living needs. Dania is a hardworking lady who is putting so much effort to improve her living and income seeking to establish one day her own perfumes and accessories selling business, when she becomes financially capable of taking this step forward.

Since Dania is working with a limited monthly salary, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her son's school tuition fees. She hopes to see her son graduating in the future with higher degrees.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school tuition fees

loans.name: Lili's Group

texts.en:
Lili is a divorcee living with her son, aged 2 years, and mother in a small village in Odagaon, Odisha, India.
