She owns and manages a tailoring shop where she stitches clothes for her customers, when they place orders for stitching. She stitches salwars, blouses, and suits, all of which are Indian traditional dress clothing, for her customers.

She has one sewing machine in her shop. She has a very good relationship with her customers, but she is not able to take orders in large amounts as she has only one sewing machine. She has a plan to purchase one more sewing machine for her shop and appoint another person as her helper, so that she can take orders in bulk and satisfy her customers.

Lili, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Lili will use her portion for purchasing a sewing machine and fabrics for taking her business to the next level.

She has a dream to have her son study in a good school and save some money for his higher studies. In the picture, the lady standing on the left is Lili.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Vanuhi

texts.en:
Vanuhi is a young farmer from Koghb village of Tavush region. She is 25 and a mother of two minor children, living with her husband and father-in-law. Vanuhi's husband is an army officer, and she and her father in law take care of the farm. They keep two calves, two cows, hens and also cultivate and sell corn, plums, grapes.

Vanuhi requests this loan to purchase a cow and a sow to enlarge the farm and gather income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a sow to increase income for the family.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 17 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva.
Ella es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela y trabajan en el negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva como, chaqueta, pantalón de sudaderas, camiseta estilo polo, pantalonetas, camisetas para atletismo y otros, sus inicios fueron como ayudante de costura dónde aprendió el oficio, “anteriormente confeccionábamos todo tipo de ropa, pero para mejorar nuestro negocio nos especializamos solamente por  este tipo de prendas...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, la desventaja son las temporadas de poca venta. Su sueño es construir su casa, ella desea comprar una máquina bordadora. Su negocio es un éxito porque realiza ventas por mayor y por menor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina bordadora para mejorar el diseño de ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Ana is a 34 year old woman, who lives with her partner, has 2 daughters, a 6 year old and a 17 year old, and her trade is making athletic apparel. 
She has a dark complexion, is short, and has a medium physique, her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she has a general knowledge of Spanish which she speaks for business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in the same trade, and with her daughters who study in school and work in the business, they live in a rented room made of brick, which has potable water, electricity and a sewage system. Her trade is making sports clothing, such as jackets, sweatpants, polo-style shirts, pants, athletic shirts, and more, she began as a sewing assistant where she learned the trade, "before we used to make all types of clothes, but to improve our business we specialize only in this type of clothing...", she commented. The advantage of her business is that she has the help of her daughter, the disadvantage is the times of low sales. Her dream is to build a house, she wishes to buy an embroidery machine. Her business is a success because she sells wholesale and retail. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 4 years she has been working in this business.  
It's for these reasons that Ana is requesting a loan to buy an embroidery machine to improve the design of her sports apparel.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine to improve the design of athletic clothing

loans.name: Sasmita's Group

texts.en:
Sasmita, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, is a differently abled lady who is a resident of a small village in Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and is a caring mother for her two sons. Sasmita's husband is a carpenter by profession and works hard to meet his family's needs.

To supplement her husband's income, Sasmita started making and selling handmade wall hangings, cushion covers, paper bags, candles, purses, etc. She makes these items in her home and sells them to the wholesalers in the nearby market.

Sasmita, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR, and she will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing fabrics, colors, paper, glue, glitters, decorative glass, wax, etc., in bulk so that she can make her crafts in a large amount.

Sasmita is in dire need of your help and is eagerly awaiting the same.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, colors, paper, glue, glitters, decorative glass, wax, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Kuni's Group

texts.en:
Kuni is a married woman who is standing in the middle in the photograph. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India.

The family earns a low income from their business, and it is not enough to provide basic living comforts. For example, one of the most critical needs is to have a hygienic toilet to use by the family.

The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible enough, as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation.

Therefore, she along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and shower in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and shower in it.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 32 years old and has a large, nice family. He is married with four children and lives with his wife, children and his retired parents. They live in the frontier village Gosh of Tavush region.

All the care and financial needs of his family are mainly Artur's duty. He used to provide taxi services with his own car, but now he only does farming and is also busy with land cultivation. On his farm Artur has cows, pigs and chickens. That enables him to provide milk, meat and eggs. Additionally, he has a large plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes and beans, and also has apple, persimmon and nut trees.

Artur sells in the region via his own car, driving it along the streets and offering fresh and tasty products. Artur greatly needs this loan as he plans to buy three calves and pigs for his farm, as well as some fodder for all his farm cattle. He hopes the increase in the number of his farm cattle will also significantly increase his family income.

loans.use: to buy three calves and pigs for his farm, as well as some fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Owen is married and has a son. He lives in a remote area called Senanga in the western part of Zambia. He makes a living by helping people who need to send and receive money from one place to the other.

He is working toward expanding his business so that he can provide a better life for his wife and son. Owen would like to thank his Kiva lenders for the help they gave him in raising his first two loans. He says the loans helped him open an outlet in Mulobezi, another remote area in the western province. Owen now has two outlets and has fully repaid his two loans.

Today, Owen is taking out another loan because he needs to open another mobile money transfer outlet. He explains that because his outlets are in rural areas, his profit margins are very low, hence the need for him to open another outlet, so that he can have more volumes of transactions.

He needs the loan in order to purchase a Zoona branded trading kiosk. The kiosk is where he will serve customers at his new location. This loan will also help Owen have the funds needed for him to serve people who need to access his services on a daily basis.

loans.use: to grow his business by purchasing a new trading kiosk and opening a new mobile money transfer outlet so that he can be able to provide for his young family.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush is a 47-year-old farmer living in Eghegnadzor town. She lives with her husband and two grown up children.

Haykanush's husband works in the private sector as a laborer and Haykanush herself helps him to sustain the family. She runs a farm. It includes livestock and cultivation of different fruits and vegetables. Her main income comes from the sale of milk, cereals, chickens and eggs, while she also buys and sells cattle on occasion.

The loan Haykanush requested will greatly help her to purchase an ox and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.

loans.use: to pay for an ox and forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, de 32 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y tiene 1 hija de 4 años de edad.

Julio, toda su vida se a dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y ahora este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; pero aparte de eso también tiene conocimientos de panadería, pues durante varios años trabajo haciendo pan.

Julio, necesita el préstamo para comprar bandejas de lata, moldes, azúcar, levadura, harina y sal, para poder implementar su propia panadería.

Julio, sueña con tener su propia panadería y ayudar a su hija para que pueda estudiar y tenga las oportunidades que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Julio, 32 years old, is a very responsable and hard working man, he didn't have the opportunity to study, he has a partner and a 4 year old daughter. 

All his life, Julio has worked in agriculture, he learned this trade from his father and now this work is the main source of income for covering the necesites for his family; but apart from that he also knows baking, because for many year he worked making bread. 

Julio needs the loan to buy tin trays, molds, sugar, yeast, flour and salt, so he can start his own bakery.

Julio dreams of having his own bakery and helping his daughter so she can study and have the opportunities that he didn't have.

loans.use: To buy tin trays, molds, sugar, yeast, flour and salt, so he can start his own bakery.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

In the past, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila will store the maize he harvests and delay sale until a date later in the season. At that time, he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Samaila now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment on his farm to members of his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

In the past, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season. At that time, he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Samaila now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike to use in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in his business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hassan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hassan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hassan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hassan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aliyu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Aliyu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Aliyu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 34-year-old married man with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For four years, he has been in produce buying maize, beans, and coffee, which has facilitated him in providing promptly the basic needs of the family and the dependents he is taking care of. He has challenges of price fluctuation of the products and poor roads due to the prolonged rainy season; nonetheless, he wishes to be a model producer dealer in his line of business. Richard needs the loan to add capital to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a hardworking, married and committed man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening and intends to develop a modern animal farm. He works hard all days of the week and is really determined to expand the farm.

Apart from that, Jackson also grows coffee and bananas to earn extra income. His animals look good and healthy and the whole farm is promising, but he has the responsibility of looking after his children and paying their fees. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital to fulfill all his dreams. Jackson needs a loan to buy mulch and manure for his coffee and banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy mulch and manure for his coffee and banana plantation

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is a 25-year-old married man. He lives in Batumi district with his wife and mother. Giorgi's mother works as a cook and gets a monthly income. Giorgi wants to open a food market and decided to get a loan and start his own business, so he sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The Startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Giorgi's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2,800 USD. With the received credit, he plans to open a food market. He already owns a commercial space, but needs to buy inventory. When the market is opened, he will have a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and open a food market.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Suleiman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Suleiman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Suleiman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Suleiman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a tea farming business in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from his salary as a primary teacher. He started farming to get more income to supplement his salary.

He is faced with a lack of capital to expand his tea plantation and buy manure so as to benefit from an already available demand for tea by factories surrounding him. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to improve the yield from his tea estates.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to improve the yield of his tea estates.

loans.name: Sukanti's Group

texts.en:
Sukanti,standing to the left hand side in the photograph, is a differently-abled lady. She is from a village in Odagaon, Odisha, India and lives there with her three children. Their financial condition is not very stable but Sukanti is determined to better it. Her husband has been supporting the family by working as a casual labour but earns a meager amount.

Sukanti also has been running a goat rearing activity from an extension of their home to earn some additional income. This way, what ever they have been earning is just enough to live with basic necessities. But within their earnings the couple has been sending their kids to college to be educated and lead a better life when they grow up.

Sukanti has been running the goat rearing business with some help from her husband and earning by selling goat's milk and kids to local villagers. Over these 4 years they have acquired more than four goats and have been successful in running the business.

Sukanti, along with her group member, is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more numbers of livestock for her business expansion so she can earn more income through this venture.

Sukanti is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to buy more numbers of livestock for her business expansion so she can earn more income through this venture.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also earns extra income from crop farming and works all days of the week. He loves to remain active as he grows old that’s why he works for eleven hours each of 7 the days in the week.

He has been running the shop for more than eight years and with the proceeds he has been able to get income and cater for his family. He wishes to expand his business to a wholesale shop but is limited by inadequate capital and competition from similar businesses. He is requesting a loan to buy crates of eggs, salt and powdered soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs, salt and powdered soap to sell.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is from Sisian town where he lives with his wife and 33-year-old daughter. Harutyun is a farmer. He owns arable land where wheat and emmer wheat is cultivated and sold in the local markets.

Besides farming, Harutyun gets income for his family by driving a taxi as well. He is hardworking and is sure that it is the only way to have success. He requested this loan to purchase wheat and emmer wheat seeds for cultivation so he can gather a rich harvest in spring and earn income for his family.

Harutyun hopes for lenders' faith and support and plans to see his farm grow.

loans.use: to pay for wheat and emmer wheat seeds for cultivation to gather a rich harvest in spring and earn income for the family.

loans.name: Omorde Bor Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of four (4) members who are called by Omorde Bor. Its members are women who maintain ties of friendship and solidarity, mainly working as traders. They live in the same localities of Chorkor in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.

Comfort, the one standing on the left with the smallish stature in the photo, is the star borrower. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children. She works as a trader by selling lining cloth and sewing at the market place.

With her loan, Comfort plans to buy more cloth for sewing since there is a festive season approaching. The rest of the loan will be her working capital. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to bolster her income with ID-Ghana and also develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for sewing since there is a festive season approaching.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a father of seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His business is banana growing on a commercial basis alongside cattle grazing where he sells milk to settle his day-to-day family demands.

Peter is a modern farmer who applies all possible modern ways of farming like applying manure, mulching and zero grazing for cattle. With the help of borrowed funds, he has been able to educate his children and is a committed client who is requesting the loan to pay school fees for his children.

He complains of unfavorable weather changes like drought which affect the banana crop in a negative way but he mulches to prevent water loss from the soil.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 23-year-old single lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a boutique where she works 12 hours a day and she has been doing this for 3 years.

In addition to clothing, she has a piggery project which also fetches her more income. Increased rent is a major hindrance as it reduces on her overall profits, however, Racheal has a goal of buying a plot and building a residential house.

Racheal has asked for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alh. Sani

texts.en:
Alhaji Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is a hardworking married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy mulches and manure for his farm. He is a farmer where he mainly crops and rears cattle to earn income.

His personal goals are to educate his children. His main hardships are inadequate capital, price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. He has a side income from a drug shop where he earns extra income.

Xavier has a vision of buying land to grow crops, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding his business to new markets.

He needs a loan to buy a piece of land for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for agriculture.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in crop farming where he mainly grows coffee and works all days of the week especially in his side business of livestock fattening. He has dealt in farming and livestock fattening for over fifteen years in order to earn a living and develop himself.

Asaph’s dream is to be a modern commercial farmer but he is limited by inadequate capital.

He seeks a loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Goden

texts.en:
Goden is a reliable married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears bulls and cows to earn income and sustain his family. Apart from livestock, Goden also grows crops like coffee, bananas, maize and beans which supplement his income and food stuff at home. This helps him reduce expenditure on feeding his family.

His desire is to educate his children, buy more land and fully develop it to a modern farm but his capital is not enough. However, he has the strength in terms of recording takings and keepings concerning his income and expenditures.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows to add to the farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to the farm.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Suleiman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Suleiman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Suleiman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Suleiman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sabiu

texts.en:
Sabiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sabiu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Sabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sabiu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sabiu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shuáibu

texts.en:
Shuáibu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shuáibu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shuáibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Shuáibu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shuáibu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shuáibu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old and a second hand clothes and shoe dealer at Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a mother of two who has been in this business for the last five years and is doing well.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase second hand clothes and shoes for resale and the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to own a shop for her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mustapha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mustapha can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mustapha will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mustapha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Norma siempre ha buscado como obtener ingresos, inicio vendiendo ropa y otra mercadería, y hace 6 años decidió poner una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, pan, huevos, especies, churros, refrescos, productos de aseo, y otros. Y para mantenerlo surtido ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, huevos, pan y otros abarrotes, esperando incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. Su plan es tener estabilidad familiar y económica.
texts.en: Norma is 37-years old. She is married and lives with her husband in a village in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Norma has always looked for a way to get an income. She began selling clothing and other merchandise and 6 years ago she decided to set up a grocery store to sell basic family need produce such as rice, beans, bread, eggs, spices, churros, soft drinks, personal care products and more. To keep her business stocked, she has asked for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy basic grains, soft drinks, candy, canned goods, cleaning products, eggs, bread and other grocery supplies, hoping to increase her sales and income. Her plan is to have family and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, candy, canned goods, cleaning products, eggs, bread and other grocery supplies to supply her business.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a 24-year-old water vendor at Old Town, Mombasa, Kenya. He is a father of one who has been in this business for the last seven years and is doing well.

This is his second loan from VisionFund to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase tanks for storing water and the anticipated profit to purchase handcarts. He hopes to have a sustainable business in future.

loans.use: to purchase tanks for storing water.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has six children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, and crop farming to provide for her family. She enjoys what she does, and it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Nangili, Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge, however, is the huge lack of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Kitale can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Elizabeth is seeking a 40,000 KES loan to buy quality seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her meet the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, increase her income so she can repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim is 69 years old and he lives with his beloved wife in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Maksim is a driver and he manages this work already for many years. Maksim’s wife is a pensioner and all the time she is at home being busy with their house care. Maksim is the only bread-winner in the family and he earns their living only through his driver's work.

Now Maksim is hopeful that Kiva lenders will help him with the solution to one very serious problem. His wife has some health problems and she must have a course of treatment. This loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams that Maksim asks for will pay for his wife’s treatment course.

loans.use: to pay for his wife’s treatment course.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is 26 years old and is a perfect young farmer, who lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. He graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute and he has a specialty of economist-engineer.

After he graduated, Khachik passed his military service and being back from the army he did not manage to find some job, so he started farming which he likes very much and now he is still engaged in it. Khachik has cows, a calf, bulls, pigs and chickens in his farm.

Khachik lives now with his mother and sister. His father is in the Russian Federation doing work. So with the help of his mother Khachik organizes the care of the farm and also its products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. They sell these locally or from their farm and mainly to their neighbors. At this moment, being the only man in the house, Khachik feels great responsibility and he tries to do all for his mother and sister and to fulfil their financial needs.

Now he is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian Drams to purchase one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle and his is hopeful that his idea and this partnership will be really profitable for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Givanna Ivonne

texts.es: Doña Givanna desea llevar a cabo su proyecto de realizar mejoras, principalmente en el piso de su vivienda. Con un préstamo de ($1,000) podrá comprar materiales de construcción, entre estos, cerámica y concreto para la reparación del piso. De esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Givanna wants to carry out her project of doing improvements, mainly on the floor of her house. With a loan of $1,000 she will be able to buy construction materials, including ceramic and concrete to repair the floor. This way she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ceramic and concrete for repairs on her home.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This woman is 45 years old and her name is Anna. She lives with her husband in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. They have a daughter who is already married and a son who lives and studies in Yerevan city. Anna has two higher educations and both of them are pedagogical. She is a specialist of English and German Languages.

From 1996 till today she works in a school as a teacher of English Language and Literature. She also gives paid private courses on her subject to the pupils who will have entrance exams. Anna likes her pedagogical occupation very much and all the work connected with it she does with greatest pleasure.

Anna is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature as all these are for such important activities for any pedagogue who wants to read self-development works.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature for self-development as a pedagogue.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Titus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Titus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Titus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Titus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Titus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rosa Agustina

texts.es:
Rosa Agustina con 45 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes que son de primera necesidad. Así mismo a la venta de verdura fresca, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de más mercadería como es la compra de zapatos,ropa y juguetes, ya que se acerca la campaña navideña y quiere aprovechar en comprar. De esta manera le generará mayores ingresos para su unidad familiar.

Rosa Agustina es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
Rosa Agustina is 45-years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in a family house with her partner and children, in the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province and department of Lambayeque, Peru. The people who live in this area mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

She works selling staple items as well as fresh vegetables and has 10 years of experience doing this. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes, clothing and toys because the Christmas season is coming up and she wants to take advantage of buying now. This way she can get a better income for her family.

Rosa Agustina is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has credit history with other financial institutions.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as shoes, clothing and toys.

loans.name: Tayrone

texts.es: Don Tayrone tiene dificultades para trasladarse hasta su lugar de trabajo, ya que necesita transportar sus herramientas de trabajo de una forma segura. Un préstamo de $2,100 puede ayudar a Tayrone a llevar a cabo su proyecto de compra de un vehículo. De esta forma podrá desplazarse a más lugares y aumentar los ingresos provenientes de su desempeño en actividades albañilería.
texts.en: Tayrone has difficulties getting to work because he needs to transport his work tools in a safe way. A loan of $2,100 can help Tayrone to carry out his project of buying a vehicle. This way he will be able to travel to more places and increase the revenue from his masonry work.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Isuwa

texts.en:
Isuwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isuwa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isuwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Isuwa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Isuwa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Isuwa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 21 лет. Он разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Она работает в школе учительницей. Также она учится в университете. В данное время она хочет оплатить договор оплаты за обучение, но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Firuza is a young and happy woman.  She is 21 years old, divorced, and the mother of one child.  She works as a school teacher and is also a university student. At the moment, she wants to pay her tuition fees, but she doesn't have enough personal resources to do so.  She has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan.  She thanks you in advance for your support and your trust.

loans.use: to pay for her own education.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina pertenece al banco comunal  CHASKA ÑAHUI,la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su negocio pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos y entradas.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the communal bank CHASKA ÑAHUI.  She continues to be committed to her travel agency business in which she has been working for years.  This member is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She is a responsible person and hopes to obtain more income through her business and to be able to continue to support her family. 

She is thankful for the loan and commits to pay all the installments. This member requests a loan to buy tickets and entrances.

loans.use: para comprar tickets and entrances

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosario es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, ella se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes.
La socia tiene 45 años y tres hijos por quien velar. Por eso ella desea ampliar su negocio, y solicito el crédito para comprar fideos, gaseosas y cereales.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de venta de fruta, actividad agrícola, brindar servicios a empresas públicas y negocio de restaurante.

Los socios están contentos por el crédito ya que le ayudara mucho en sus objetivos económicos.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS.  This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, province of Quispicanchis, in Cusco. 
 
Rosario is an enterprising person with determination, committed to her groceries business.  She is 45 years old and has three children to take care of.  This is why she wants to expand her business and requests a loan to buy noodles, fizzy drinks and cereals.  

The other members work selling livestock, fruit, and in agriculture.  They also work providing services to public companies and in restaurants.  The members are happy for the credit since it will help them to achieve their economic goals.

loans.use: to buy noodles, fizzy drinks and cereals.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru:
Зайнура  молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. У неё высшее образование. Она работает акушеркой в районной больнице. 
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Зайнура вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Зайнура выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Зайнура получает хороший доход. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Зайнура с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Зайнура заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Zaynura is a young and hardworking 26-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She has a higher education and works as a midwife at the local hospital.

In order to have a stable source of income to provide for their family, Zaynura and her husband have started their own business.  They are now involved in animal husbandry.  Zaynura raises livestock and then sells their meat and milk.  She makes a good income from this activity.  The couple's combined income is sufficient for an average standard of living but they still don't have enough resources to cover all their needs.

At the moment, Zaynura and her husband want to buy a few additional head of livestock for fattening.  For this reason, Zaynura has turned to MDO Arvand to request a loan for the purchase of livestock.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support, which will help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans qui habite à Baguida. Mère de deux enfants, Afi est une revendeuse de fruits qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Afi revend ses marchandises à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des paniers de bananes, des unités d’ananas et d’oranges en vue bien vendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de maximiser son profit et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is 47 years old, married, and lives in Baguida. She has two children.

Afi works selling fruits that she procures four times a month from a market. She makes her resales from the front of her home and in the surrounding areas. She is seeking this loan to make an order of bananas, pineapple, and oranges.

Afi aims to make good sales and earn enough to maximize her profits and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two trays of bananas, 40 pineapples, and 30 oranges.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia sigue con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera que mediante su negocio pueda obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz entre otros.
texts.en: This member continues with her groceries store in which she has worked for years.  She is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in day after day.  She is a responsible person and hopes that through her business she can increase her income so that she can continue to support her family.  She is thankful for the loan and commits to pay all the instalments.  She has requested this loan to buy oil and rice, among other things.

loans.use: to buy oil and rice, among other things

loans.name: Josette Jallue

texts.fr:
Josette a 41 ans, elle vit en concubinage avec son mari qui exerce également dans le petit commerce. Le couple a 3 enfants: l’ainé a 16 ans et deux jumeaux de 7 ans. 
Elle vend des articles de cuisine en plastique. Elle a exercé cette activité depuis 2011. Elle a déjà eu de l’expérience dans la vente de plusieurs produits, elle trouve que ce sont les articles de cuisines  qui sont les plus prisés par les clients au marché.L’activité est rentable. 
Le prêt sert à acheter des articles diversifiés qui seront revendus au marché: verres, assiettes, cuvettes, sceaux, balais, boîtes, 
L’objectif est de pouvoir diversifier les produits et d’augmenter la quantité afin d’avoir une épargne suffisante. Le couple projette de devenir un grossiste dans le domaine.
texts.en:
Josette is 41 years old and lives with her husband. They both work in small-scale commerce. The couple has three children--the eldest is 16 years old and the youngest are 7-year-old twins.

Josette has been selling plastic kitchen utensils since 2011. She already had experience in commerce, and she found that kitchen products were the most popular with the customers at the market. This work is profitable.

This loan serves to buy various goods which will be resold at the market: cups, plates, bowls, buckets, brooms, containers, etc.

Her goal is to be able to diversify her products and increase her stock in order to save sufficiently.

Josette and her husband aim to become wholesalers in the area.

loans.use: to buy different types of kitchen utensils, brooms, and brushes.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose a la venta de comestibles, él socio se siente agradecido con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, él socio continua vendiendo  lo que son arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable de esta manera el socio espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar aceite, arroz entre otros.
texts.en: This member continues working selling groceries. He is thankful for the credit and commits to pay the instalments. He continues to sell rice, sugar, and milk, among other things, to all the customers who request them. This member is a responsible person; this is how he hopes to get a better income with his business, so that he can keep on supporting his family. This member requests a loan to buy oil and rice, among other things.

loans.use: to buy oil and rice, among other things.

loans.name: Noelie

texts.fr: Noelie est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Noelie est âgée de 34 ans et vit à Baguida où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice du haricot et du maïs. Noelie s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Noelie sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols du haricot, le sac de maïs et des litres d’huile en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Noelie is a married woman with four children under her care.  She is 34 years old and she lives in Baguida where she cooks and sells dishes based on beans and corn.  She stocks up with the necessary ingredients twice a month at the market.  She sells her dishes inside a warehouse, in front of her house.

Noelie is taking this loan to buy some bowlfuls of beans, one bag of maize, and a few liters of oil.  Her goal is to increase her sales and profits so that she can help her husband to cover the family's needs and improve her children's daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one bag of maize, five bowlfuls of beans and six liters of oil.

loans.name: Georgina Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sucre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Georgina, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5  hijos mayores de edad e independientes con ella vive un nieto de 21 años el cual los acompaña. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Georgina con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos como ropa, zapatos y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente,  le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace 10 años razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Lleva más de 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The credit group Sucre gather every 15 days at the Cantón Montecristi, the place of the Panamá hat, known  both at a national or international level  for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its craftsmanship.  In that place Georgina lives.  She is 58 years old, married and from that relationship there are five children who are all grown-up and live independently.  They live with a grandson who is 21 years old and keeps them company.  Her husband is a driver. 

With the aim of having her own income, Georgina sells products by catalogue like, clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry.  She sells them door to door.  She goes out almost every day, mainly during the morning since she finds it easier to do the run.  She sells on credit, and collects the payments on a weekly basis.  She loves selling and she has been doing it for 10 years, for which reason she has good customers.  This loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She has been part of this credit group for five years and she likes it because with those loans she can finance her business. Her dream is to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль, 30 лет, не замужем, детей нет. Основной деятельностью Айгуль является предоставление услуг общественного питания. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе, Айгуль достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства, на сегодня ее бизнес приносит 32,000 сом (KGS). Место кафе проходное, много клиентов, уже наработаны и постоянные клиенты. В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, а также увеличение прибыли от бизнеса, Айгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оборудования для кафе. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aigul is 30 years old, single, and has no children.  Her primary business is food services.  As a result of an enormous amount of back-breaking work, Aigul has attained great success in developing her business and today it brings in 32,000 som (KGS).  Her café is located in a place with a lot of passersby and she has many customers, including long-time regulars.

With the goal of developing her business further and to increase its profits, Aigul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to by equipment for her café.  Aigul plans to invest the profits from the loan in further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her cafe

loans.name: Jean Patrick

texts.fr:
Jean Patrick vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Ceci lui a permis de renforcer le fonds de roulement et augmenter les stocks des matières premières. Les clients ainsi que les commandes augmentent petit à petit 
d'où la raison de renouvellement de demande  de crédit. Il voudrait devenir grossiste dans ce domaine d'activité 
Il vient de faire l'inscription de son dernier enfant donc les trois enfants sont tous scolarisés actuellement, une raison de plus qui lui pousse à améliorer son revenu. Son souhait est la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études et la vie en générale. En outre, il voudrait construire sa propre maison dès que sa situation financière le permettra.
texts.en:
Jean Patrick thanks you very much for [his previous] loan. It allowed him to increase his cash flow and increase his stock of products.

His customers and orders have increased little by little, and for this reason he is seeking a new loan. He would like to become a wholesaler in this area of business.

He has just signed his youngest child up for school, which means now all three of his children are currently attending school. This is yet another reason that he is trying to increase his revenues.

Jean Patrick wishes that his children can succeed in school and life in general. He also would like to build his own house when his financial situation permits it.

loans.use: to buy raffia, dyes, glue, and cloth woven of raffia.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor en pequeño, juntos tienen 3 hijos que viven con ellos y todos trabajan en la agricultura y en los oficios domésticos. 

Ana, se ha dedicado a los oficios del hogar y también a trabajado como empleada doméstica en casas ajenas; pero por el momento solo cuida a sus hijos y a sus padres y ayuda su esposo e hijos en las labores agrícolas y cuida el ganado de su hijo. 

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar novillas, porque actualmente el precio del ganado ha disminuido y quiere aprovechar e invertir para después venderlas.

Los sueños de Ana, sueña con seguir trabajando y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 44 years old, studied up to third grade and is married. Her husband is a small scale farmer. Together they have three children who live with them, and all of them work in agriculture and in domestic work. Ana has been working in domestic work of the house and has also worked as a domestic service worker at other houses.

At the moment she only takes care of her children and her parents, helps her husband and children with agricultural labor, while looking after her son's cattle.

Ana needs the loan to buy heifers, because cattle prices have fallen recently, and she wants to take advantage of this in order to invest and sell the heifers later.

Ana dreams to continue working and improve her housing.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Jose Robinson

texts.es:
José Robinson con 32 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive junto a su familia, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se desempeña como mototaxista, con más de 1 año de experiencia en este servicio, sus servicios los brinda dentro la zona geográfica de Oyotún. Solicita préstamo para el mejoramiento de infraestructura donde guarda su mototaxi, dicha inversión le servirá para conservar en mejores condiciones su mototaxi, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa en tener en mejores condiciones su mototaxi para poder seguir satisfaciendo de la mejor manera la demanda de dicho servicio en la zona.

José Robinson es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José Robinson, 32 years old and single, lives together with his family in the rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo Province, Department of Lambayeque, Perú. He counts on very good personal as well as work references from the residents. The majority of the area's residents work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock farming.

El works as a motortaxi driver. With more than one year of experience in this business, he offers the service within the geographic area of Oyotún.

He is requesting for a loan to improve the infrastructure of where he keeps his motortaxi. This investment will help conserve his motortaxi in better conditions, with a great influence on his business. In this manner, he hopes to have his motortaxi in better conditions so that he can continue meeting the demand in the area in the best way possible.

José Robinson is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of where he keeps his motortaxi.

loans.name: Ravaka Romy

texts.fr:
Ravaka Romy a 34 ans, elle est mariée, et a 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Son marie est vendeur dans une quincaillerie. C’est une bonne mère de famille. 
Elle vend des produits de la friperie, c’est une activité familiale. Elle a 9 ans d’expérience. Son expérience et les prêts obtenus lui ont permis de développer l’activité: augmentation et diversification des produits et du chiffre d’affaires. Le prêt servira à acheter des produits de la friperie  pour la revente: pantalons pour homme et femme et  robes
Elle a pour objectif la réussite de ses enfants dans leur parcours et d’embellir et étendre sa maison.
texts.en:
Ravaka Romy is 34 years old, married, and has two children in school. She is a good mother. Her husband works in a hardware store.

Ravaka Romy sells used clothing, which is a family business. She has nine years of experience.

The loans she has received previously have allowed her to develop her business--increase and diversify her products and sales.

This loan will serve to buy used clothing to resell: dresses and pants for men and women.

Her goal is to see her children succeed in life. She would also like to beatify and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy dresses and pants for men and women.

loans.name: 30 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
Victoria continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano (de pie a la derecha, viste chompa azul]). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer su negocio, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajó de forma continua. Actualmente los negocios de los socios mejoraron y se ampliaron, es por eso que la banca sigue trabajando junta, “pude comprar ropa para mi negocio y realicé otro emprendimiento en el negocio de la comida…” comenta. 
Victoria incursionó en el rubro de la comida, dedicándose a preparar comida por las mañanas para venderla a la hora de almuerzo y así tener el resto del día para vender ropa de segunda mano. La ventaja de sus actividades es que ambas son libres y pueden cambiar de horarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer de insumos de cocina y comprar ropa para la venta. Su sueño es consolidar ambos negocios, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina y ropa de segunda mano por mayor para trabajar en sus 2 negocios. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina y ropa de segunda mano por mayor para sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Victoria continues with her business of secondhand clothing sales (she is standing in the right, dressed in a blue sweater). The loan that she obtained was used to buy secondhand clothing at wholesale in order to supply her business. The repayments were punctual as she worked continuously.

Recently the businesses of the members improved and expanded. It is for this reason that the communal bank continues to work together. “I could buy clothes for my business and I also started another business en food sales…" comments Victoria.

Victoria ventured into the food business, working to prepare food in the morning and sell during lunchtime, with the rest of the day left to sell secondhand clothing. The strength of her businesses is that both businesses are free and and can change the time. The weakness is the lack of capital to supply cooking ingredients and buy clothes for sale.

Her dream is to consolidate both businesses. She wishes to buy cooking ingredients and secondhand clothing at wholesale to work in her two businesses. This is the third sequences of loans with the Institution during the two years in which she grew her two businesses.

For this reason, Victoria is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients and secondhand clothing at wholesale for her two businesses.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and secondhand clothing at wholesale for their 2 businesses

loans.name: Seheno Aimée

texts.fr:
Seheno est une femme divorcée de 29ans . Elle a 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés.  Elle assume seule les responsabilités parentales vis à vis de ses enfants. Son ex-mari ne l'appui point en aucun cas. C'est une femme très courageuse et travailleuse.
Elle vend des produits de friperie tels que robe et pantalon et surtout des chaussures à l'occasion. Le développement de cette activité dépend de la qualité et de la diversification des produits même si ce sont des produits de la friperie. Elle a déjà l’expérience dans le choix des produits. Elle cherche toujours les moyens pour le développement de l’activité par l’augmentation de stock  d’où cette demande prêt. Elle trouve que son activité évolue car les produits sont diversifies et la quantité augmente
Le rêve est de pouvoir construire une maison en brique, elle et ses enfants habitent dans une maison en bois actuellement.
texts.en:
Seheno is 29 years old and divorced. She has four children, of whom three are in school. She carries all the responsibility for taking care of the children. Her ex-husband does not offer any support.

Seheno is very brave and hard-working. She sells used clothing, such as dresses and pants, and especially shoes.

The development of this business depends on the quality and the diversification of her products, even if these products are used. She already had experience in picking out products.

Seheno always searches for the means to develop her business by increasing her stock. That is why she is seeking this loan. She finds that her business evolves through an increase and diversification of products.

Her dream is to build a house out of brick. Currently, she and her children live in a wooden house.

loans.use: to buy used tennis shoes, dresses, and pants.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Jeanine est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Bon Berger», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des poissons dans la rue  de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 400 poissons. Elle débuta par le premier fonds reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: Jeanine is a trader and member of the "Bon Berger" Banc Villageois. A customer of IMF Hekima, she is 31 years old, married and mother to five children, four of whom are at school while one is still very young. She has been selling fish in the town's road for the past ten years. She is going to buy 400 fish. She began her business with a loan. She would like to be able to buy a plot of land, as well as to educate and feed her children. Finally she would like to thank Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks. It should be noted that some of the customers in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to stock up with 400 fish.
